analyzed: mel tshe byos dang legs par 'gyur ro zhes smras nas /

original: tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad de smras pa /

analyzed: chos spyod chos ma yin ma @12b spyod; ;bden pa smros shig brdzun ma smra //

analyzed: mun pa chen por 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: You will enter great darkness.

original: de bas ma nyal mel tshe byos //
analyzed: de bas ma nyal mel tshe byos //
translated: So do not sleep, but keep watch.”

original: de nam nangs nas sh'akya ming chen gyis rgyal po zas gtsang la smras pa /
analyzed: de nam nangs nas sh'akya ming chen gyis rgyal po zas gtsang la smras pa /
translated: When dawn came, Śākya Mahānāman said to King Śuddhodana,

analyzed: lha dgung sangs lags te /
translated: “Your Majesty, the night has passed.

original: dgung bdun la dgung gcig ni thal /
analyzed: dgung bdun la dgung gcig ni thal /
translated: Of the seven nights, one has passed.

original: dgung drug ni lus so //
analyzed: dgung drug ni lus so //
translated: Six days is the body.

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gis smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gis smras pa /
translated: King Śuddhodana said,

original: legs kyis zhag drug 'das na /
analyzed: legs kyis zhag drug 'das na /
translated: “All right. After six days have passed,

original: gzhon nu 'khor lo sgyur bar gyur na /
analyzed: gzhon nu 'khor lo sgyur bar gyur na /
translated: if the prince becomes a universal monarch,

original: bdag cag nam mkha'i ngos la rgyu zhing gling bzhir phyi bzhin dong ngo //
analyzed: bdag cag nam mkha'i ngos la rgyu zhing gling bzhir phyi bzhin dong ngo //
translated: we will follow him to the four continents as he travels through the sky.”

original: de bzhin du dgongs gcig lus so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgongs gcig lus so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: In the same way, one day remains,” and so on up to

analyzed: lha rnams kyis dbang po brgya byin gyi shes pa mthong ba ni 'og tu 'jug pa yin pas tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: “The gods see the consciousness of Śakra, lord of the gods, entering below. They spoke this verse:

original: mi dbang sh'akya sras po thub pa 'di //
analyzed: mi dbang sh'akya sras po thub pa 'di //
translated: “This Śākya prince, lord of men, the sage,

original: bdag nyid chen po pha rol phyin drug rdzogs //🔽thub rnams dgyes pa mdzad pa dka' thub tshal //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po pha rol phyin drug rdzogs // thub rnams dgyes pa mdzad pa dka' thub tshal //
translated: this great being who has perfected the six perfections,

original: 'phags pa dgyes pas nags su gshegs par bzhed //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pas nags su gshegs par bzhed //
translated: has gone to the forest to please the sages🔽and to please the noble ones.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' btsun mo dang lhan cig skyes pa med pa na rol mos rtse bar byed /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' btsun mo dang lhan cig skyes pa med pa na rol mos rtse bar byed /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, together with the queens, played, enjoyed, and amused himself in the pleasure grove without a man present.

original: dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dga' bar byed /
translated: He played, enjoyed, and amused himself.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa na 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa na 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: When he was enjoying himself with her, he thought,

original: bdag la gzhan dag gzhon nu sh'akya thub pa ni skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la gzhan dag gzhon nu sh'akya thub pa ni skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: “Others will say of me, ‘Prince Śākyamuni is not a man.

original: gang gi phyir grags 'dzin ma dang / sa 'tsho ma dang / ri dvags skyes dang / bud med drug khri spangs nas rab tu byung ngo zhes gzhi des kha zer bar 'gyur du 'ong gis //
analyzed: gang gi phyir grags 'dzin ma dang / sa 'tsho ma dang / ri dvags skyes dang / bud med drug khri spangs nas rab tu byung ngo zhes gzhi des kha zer bar 'gyur du 'ong gis //
translated: Because he has renounced Yaśodharā, Gopā, Mṛgāra’s daughter, and sixty thousand women and gone forth.’

original: ma la bdag gis grags 'dzin ma dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyad par bya'o snyam nas des grags 'dzin ma dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyad pa dang @13a *//
analyzed: ma la bdag gis grags 'dzin ma dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyad par bya'o snyam nas des grags 'dzin ma dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyad pa dang @13a *//
translated: “ ‘Well then, I will enjoy myself with Yaśodharā.’ He enjoyed himself with Yaśodharā.

original: grags 'dzin ma sems can dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma sems can dang ldan par gyur nas /
translated: Yaśodharā became pregnant.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te nam langs nas byang chub sems dpa'i snyan du gsol lo snyam mo //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te nam langs nas byang chub sems dpa'i snyan du gsol lo snyam mo //

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas de'i tshe /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva,

analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang ldan pas tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
translated: at that time, spoke this verse that is in accord with dependent origination:

original: bud med dang bdag khyim nyal ba'i //
analyzed: bud med dang bdag khyim nyal ba'i //

original: tha ma deng gi 'di yin te //
analyzed: tha ma deng gi 'di yin te //
translated: This is the last time I will sleep with a woman in a house.

original: phyin chad khyim du bud med dang // nga ni lhan cig mi gnas so //
analyzed: phyin chad khyim du bud med dang // nga ni lhan cig mi gnas so //

analyzed: de nas bud med de rnams gar dang glu dang rol mos dub nas /
translated: Then those women, exhausted from dancing, singing, and playing music,

analyzed: kha nas kha chu 'dzag cing skra zhig la gos dang lag pa dag lhug par btang nas /
translated: with saliva dripping from their mouths, their hair disheveled, their clothes and limbs loose,

original: brla ba'i tshig byung rgyal du brdol zhing gnyid log go /
analyzed: brla ba'i tshig byung rgyal du brdol zhing gnyid log go /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bud med de dag thams cad kha nas kha chu 'dzag cing skra zhig la gos dang lag pa dag lhug par btang nas /
translated: The Bodhisattva saw that all those women, with saliva dripping from their mouths, their hair disheveled, their clothes and limbs loose,

analyzed: brla ba'i tshig byung rgyal du brdol zhing gnyid log pa gzigs so //
translated: their thighs and armpits exposed, had fallen asleep.

original: gzigs nas kyang btsun mo'i 'khor la dur khrod kyi 'du shes skyes nas /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang btsun mo'i 'khor la dur khrod kyi 'du shes skyes nas /
translated: Having seen that, he had the perception of a charnel ground toward the retinue of queens.

original: des tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
analyzed: des tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /

original: rlung gi shugs kyis padma'i tshal ltar sa gzhi 'dir //
analyzed: rlung gi shugs kyis padma'i tshal ltar sa gzhi 'dir //
translated: Like a lotus grove by the force of the wind,

original: lag pa dag dang rkang pa brkyang nas 'gyel gyur te //
analyzed: lag pa dag dang rkang pa brkyang nas 'gyel gyur te //
translated: They are lying there with their arms and legs stretched out,

original: skra rnams zhig cing mdog dang rkub kyi phyogs snang ba //
analyzed: skra rnams zhig cing mdog dang rkub kyi phyogs snang ba //
translated: Their hair disheveled, their faces and buttocks exposed.

analyzed: sh'akya'i sras kyis gzigs nas rang bzhin skyo bar gyur //

original: tshul dang bral ba'i bud med na chung tshogs 'di dag /
analyzed: tshul dang bral ba'i bud med na chung tshogs 'di dag /

analyzed: dur khor 'jigs su rung ba'i rang bzhin 'drar mthong nas //
translated: Are seen to be like the terrifying nature of a charnel ground.

original: sems can byis pa'i spyod pa'i yul la deng dga' na //
analyzed: sems can byis pa'i spyod pa'i yul la deng dga' na //
translated: If they are delighted now in the realm of childish conduct,

analyzed: sems dang blo gros dran dang bral ba yin nam ci //
translated: Are they devoid of mind, intelligence, and mindfulness?

original: 'dod pa tha chad @13b 'dam dang mda' mdung dug me 'dra //
analyzed: 'dod pa tha chad @13b 'dam dang mda' mdung dug me 'dra //
translated: Desires are like a swamp, an arrow, a spear, or poison.

original: rmi lam lta bu yin te tsha chu'i ro dang mtshungs //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu yin te tsha chu'i ro dang mtshungs //
translated: They are like a dream, or like the taste of hot water.

original: 'dod pa phung me rtsod dang sdig pa'i rgyur gyur pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa phung me rtsod dang sdig pa'i rgyur gyur pa //
translated: Desires are a mass of fire, a cause of strife and evil.

original: mtha' ngan sbrul gyi dbang po lta bu bdag gis spangs //
analyzed: mtha' ngan sbrul gyi dbang po lta bu bdag gis spangs //
translated: I have abandoned them, like a bad end, like the head of a snake.

original: bar skabs der skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo'i rmi lam du bzhi rmis pa /
analyzed: bar skabs der skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo'i rmi lam du bzhi rmis pa /
translated: In the meantime, Mahāprajāpatī had four dreams:

original: zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin pa dang / nyi ma shar phyogs nas shar nas de nyid du nub pa dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen pos bdag la phyag byas pa dang / bdag nyid dgod cing du ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin pa dang / nyi ma shar phyogs nas shar nas de nyid du nub pa dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen pos bdag la phyag byas pa dang / bdag nyid dgod cing du ba'o //
translated: the moon being eclipsed by Rāhu, the sun rising in the east and setting there, a great crowd of people bowing to me, and I myself laughing and crying.

original: grags 'dzin ma'i rmi lam du brgyad rmis pa /
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma'i rmi lam du brgyad rmis pa /
translated: Yaśodharā had eight dreams:

original: bdag nyid kyi khyim gyi gdung chag pa dang / bkra shis kyi mal khri chag pa dang / lag pa'i gdub bu chag pa dang / so'i phreng ba lhags pa dang / skra'i lan bu zhig pa dang / dpal khyim nas byung ba dang / zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi khyim gyi gdung chag pa dang / bkra shis kyi mal khri chag pa dang / lag pa'i gdub bu chag pa dang / so'i phreng ba lhags pa dang / skra'i lan bu zhig pa dang / dpal khyim nas byung ba dang / zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin pa dang /
translated: the collapse of the pillar in her house, the collapse of her auspicious bed, the breaking of her armlet, the falling out of her tooth, the loosening of her braid, the departure of her glory, the moon being eclipsed by Rāhu,

original: nyi ma shar phyogs nas shar nas de nyid du nub pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma shar phyogs nas shar nas de nyid du nub pa'o //
translated: and the sun rising in the east and setting there.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang rmang lam lnga rmis pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang rmang lam lnga rmis pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva also had five dreams:

original: sa chen po nyid kyi gzim mal du byas shing /
analyzed: sa chen po nyid kyi gzim mal du byas shing /
translated: the great earth itself serving as his bed,

original: ri rab ri'i rgyal po dbu rten du bcug /
analyzed: ri rab ri'i rgyal po dbu rten du bcug /
translated: and Mount Meru, the king of mountains, serving as his pillow.

original: phyag g-yon pa shar phyogs kyi rgya mtsho chen por 'jug /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa shar phyogs kyi rgya mtsho chen por 'jug /
translated: His left hand plunged into the great ocean in the east.

original: phyag g-yas pa nub phyogs kyi rgya mtsho chen por 'jug /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa nub phyogs kyi rgya mtsho chen por 'jug /
translated: His right hand plunged into the great ocean in the west.

original: zhabs gnyis rgya mtsho chen por 'jug pa dang / 'grong ba zhes bya ba'i rtsa'i rigs lte ba nas byung nas nam mkha'i bar du 'phags te 'dug pa dang / bya kun nas dkar la mgo gnag pa rnams kyis zhabs gnyis la gtugs nas pus mo'i lha nga la thug gi bar du ldag pa dang /
analyzed: zhabs gnyis rgya mtsho chen por 'jug pa dang / 'grong ba zhes bya ba'i rtsa'i rigs lte ba nas byung nas nam mkha'i bar du 'phags te 'dug pa dang / bya kun nas dkar la mgo gnag pa rnams kyis zhabs gnyis la gtugs nas pus mo'i lha nga la thug gi bar du ldag pa dang /
translated: His two feet plunged into the great ocean. A type of channel called “the one that binds” arose from his navel and extended into space. White birds with black heads pecked at his two feet until they reached his knees.

original: bya sna tshogs phyogs bzhi nas 'ongs nas mdun du kha dog gcig tu 'dug pa dang / mi @14a *//
analyzed: bya sna tshogs phyogs bzhi nas 'ongs nas mdun du kha dog gcig tu 'dug pa dang / mi @14a *//
translated: Various birds came from the four directions and gathered in front of him, all becoming the same color.

original: gtsang ba'i ri'i steng nas bdag nyid mi gtsang bas ma gos par 'chag pa'o //
analyzed: gtsang ba'i ri'i steng nas bdag nyid mi gtsang bas ma gos par 'chag pa'o //
translated: He walked on the mountain of filth without being soiled by the filth.

original: rmis nas kyang thugs dgyes te dgongs pa /
analyzed: rmis nas kyang thugs dgyes te dgongs pa /
translated: After having this dream, he was delighted and thought,

original: nga'i rmi lam 'di 'dra ba rmis pas ring po mi thogs pa kho nar bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: nga'i rmi lam 'di 'dra ba rmis pas ring po mi thogs pa kho nar bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: “Since I have had this kind of dream, it is certain that I will attain unsurpassed wisdom before long.”

original: de nas grags 'dzin mas byang chub sems dpa' la rmi lam gsol ba /
analyzed: de nas grags 'dzin mas byang chub sems dpa' la rmi lam gsol ba /
translated: Then Yaśodharā told the Bodhisattva her dreams:

original: lha da gzod bdag gi g-yar lam du brgyad rmis pa /
analyzed: lha da gzod bdag gi g-yar lam du brgyad rmis pa /
translated: “O Lord, I had eight dreams:

original: bdag gi sdum pa'i gdung chag pa dang / bkra shis kyi mal khri chag pa dang / sug pa'i gdub bu chag pa dang / so'i phreng ba lhags pa dang / skra'i lan bu zhig pa dang / dpal sdum pa nas byung ba dang / zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gi sdum pa'i gdung chag pa dang / bkra shis kyi mal khri chag pa dang / sug pa'i gdub bu chag pa dang / so'i phreng ba lhags pa dang / skra'i lan bu zhig pa dang / dpal sdum pa nas byung ba dang / zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin pa dang /
translated: The pillar of my house broke, the auspicious bed broke, the bracelet on my arm broke, my row of teeth fell out, my braid of hair came undone, my glory left my house, the moon was seized by Rāhu,

original: gdugs shar phyogs nas bdal nas de nyid du nub pa rmis lags so //
analyzed: gdugs shar phyogs nas bdal nas de nyid du nub pa rmis lags so //
translated: and the sun rose in the east and set there.”

original: byang chub sems dpas grags 'dzin ma'i yid mi bde ba bsal ba'i phyir rmi lam rnams bshad pa /🔽bdag gis khyim gyi gdung chag go zhes smras pa gang yin pa de mi 'dug gam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas grags 'dzin ma'i yid mi bde ba bsal ba'i phyir rmi lam rnams bshad pa / bdag gis khyim gyi gdung chag go zhes smras pa gang yin pa de mi 'dug gam /
translated: In order to dispel Yaśodharā’s distress, the Bodhisattva explained the dreams:🔽“Is it not true that you said, ‘The pillar of my house broke’?

original: bdag gi bkra shis kyi mal khri chag go zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang ma chag ste 'dug pa'o ni yin mod /
analyzed: bdag gi bkra shis kyi mal khri chag go zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang ma chag ste 'dug pa'o ni yin mod /
translated: It is true that you said, ‘The auspicious bed broke,’ but it did not break.

original: lag pa gdub bu chag go zhes smras pa gang yin pa ci chag gam ma chag rang nyid rtogs shig /🔽so'i phreng ba lhags so zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pas ci lhags sam ma lhags rtogs shig /
analyzed: lag pa gdub bu chag go zhes smras pa gang yin pa ci chag gam ma chag rang nyid rtogs shig / so'i phreng ba lhags so zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pas ci lhags sam ma lhags rtogs shig /
translated: As for the statement, “My bracelet broke,” you should know for yourself whether it broke or not.🔽As for the statement, “My teeth fell out,” you should know for yourself whether they fell out or not.

original: bdag gi lan bu zhig go zhes gang smras pa de yang khyod kyis so so rang gis rig @14b par bya ba yin pas ci zhig gam ma zhig rtogs shig /
analyzed: bdag gi lan bu zhig go zhes gang smras pa de yang khyod kyis so so rang gis rig @14b par bya ba yin pas ci zhig gam ma zhig rtogs shig /
translated: As for the statement, “My braid came undone,” you should know for yourself whether it came undone or not.

original: khyim nas dpal byung ngo zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni bud med rnams kyi dpal ni khyo yin la nga ni 'dug pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyim nas dpal byung ngo zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni bud med rnams kyi dpal ni khyo yin la nga ni 'dug pa nyid do //
translated: As for the statement, “My glory left the house,” the glory of women is their husband, and I am right here.

original: zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin ces smras pa gang yin pa de ni zla ba 'di mngon sum du 'dug pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin ces smras pa gang yin pa de ni zla ba 'di mngon sum du 'dug pa ma yin nam /
translated: As for the statement, “Rahu seized the moon,” isn’t the moon right here?

original: nyi ma shar phyogs nas shar nas de nyid du nub bo zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni da dung yang nam phyed yod de /
analyzed: nyi ma shar phyogs nas shar nas de nyid du nub bo zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni da dung yang nam phyed yod de /
translated: As for the statement, “The sun rose in the east and set in the east,” it is still the middle of the night.

original: re zhig shar kyang ma shar na nub par lta ga la 'gyur zhes de ltar brda sprad nas /
analyzed: re zhig shar kyang ma shar na nub par lta ga la 'gyur zhes de ltar brda sprad nas /
translated: If it rises for a while and then does not rise, how could it set?”

original: btsun mo grags 'dzin cang mi smra bar 'dug go /
analyzed: btsun mo grags 'dzin cang mi smra bar 'dug go /
translated: Queen Yaśodharā remained silent.

original: byang chub sems dpas dgongs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas dgongs pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva thought,

original: grags 'dzin ma'i rmi lam de 'dra ba rmis pas gdon mi za bar nga kho na bdag 'gro bar byas 'di la tshig zur gyis bstan no snyam nas /
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma'i rmi lam de 'dra ba rmis pas gdon mi za bar nga kho na bdag 'gro bar byas 'di la tshig zur gyis bstan no snyam nas /
translated: “Since Yaśodharā had such a dream, she must be thinking, ‘Without a doubt, he will leave me.’ I will teach her with a hint.”

original: des de la tshig zur gyis bstan pa dang / grags 'dzin mas gsol pa /
analyzed: des de la tshig zur gyis bstan pa dang / grags 'dzin mas gsol pa /
translated: He taught her with a hint, and Yaśodharā said,

original: lha khyod gang du bzhud pa der bdag khrid cig /
analyzed: lha khyod gang du bzhud pa der bdag khrid cig /
translated: “Wherever you go, god, take me with you.”

original: byang chub sems dpas mya ngan las 'das pa las dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas mya ngan las 'das pa las dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva, thinking of passing into nirvāṇa, said,

original: de bzhin du bya ste gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang der khyod bkri'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bya ste gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang der khyod bkri'o //
translated: “I will do that. Wherever I go, I will take you there.”

original: de nas brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs te /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs te /
translated: Then Śakra, Brahmā, and so forth,

original: lha rnams kyi sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa shes nas /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i dgongs pa shes nas /
translated: the gods, understood the Bodhisattva’s thoughts.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang na ba der song ste phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽nags kyi spre'u ni spyod yul rgyu 'dra zhing //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang na ba der song ste phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces gsol to // nags kyi spre'u ni spyod yul rgyu 'dra zhing //
translated: He went to the Bodhisattva and said to him:🔽“You are like a monkey in the forest,

original: yan par 'dug pa'i rte'u dang 'dra'i thugs //
analyzed: yan par 'dug pa'i rte'u dang 'dra'i thugs //
translated: your mind is like a young calf.

original: gal te 'dod pa'i yon tan las bzlog na //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i yon tan las bzlog na //
translated: If you turn away from the pleasures of desire,

original: de nas shin tu gsal ba'i snang ba gzigs //
analyzed: de nas shin tu gsal ba'i snang ba gzigs //
translated: then you will see a very clear light.

original: ba lang gi bshan pa'i slob ma mkhas pas ba lang gsod pa'i gri rnon pos ba glang gi lto dral na de'i khong du khong gi tshor ba shin tu mi bzad pa skye ba de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan🔽dag la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
analyzed: ba lang gi bshan pa'i slob ma mkhas pas ba lang gsod pa'i gri rnon pos ba glang gi lto dral na de'i khong du khong gi tshor ba shin tu mi bzad pa skye ba de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
translated: In the same way, at that time, when the bodhisattva entered the concentration on the bloated,🔽unbearable feelings arose in his belly.

original: khong du khong gi tshor ba shin tu mi bzad pa skyes kyang de zhum pa ma yin gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin //
analyzed: khong du khong gi tshor ba shin tu mi bzad pa skyes kyang de zhum pa ma yin gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin //
translated: But he was not discouraged, he exerted his effort.

original: lus ma sbyangs pa ma yin gyi sbyangs pa yin /
analyzed: lus ma sbyangs pa ma yin gyi sbyangs pa yin /
translated: His body was not untrained, it was trained.

original: rmugs pa ma yin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rmugs pa ma yin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
translated: He was not sluggish, he was mindful.

original: sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: His mind was one-pointedly concentrated.

original: byang chub sems dpas sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rtsub pa tsha ba yid du mi 'ong pa'i tshor ba de lta bu nyams su myong yang 'di ltar sku bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir thugs yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rtsub pa tsha ba yid du mi 'ong pa'i tshor ba de lta bu nyams su myong yang 'di ltar sku bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir thugs yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so //
translated: Although the Bodhisattva experienced such unbearable, harsh, painful, and unpleasant feelings, he did not give up his practice of austerities.

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thought:

original: me la bdag gis lhag par rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag @30b la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o snyam mo //🔽de lhag par rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug par brtsams te /
analyzed: me la bdag gis lhag par rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag @30b la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o snyam mo // de lhag par rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug par brtsams te /
translated: “I will enter the meditation of the great decomposition.”🔽He began to enter the meditation of the great decomposition.

original: des rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
analyzed: des rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
translated: When he entered the meditation of the great decomposition,

original: zhal dang shangs nas dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba bgags so //
analyzed: zhal dang shangs nas dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba bgags so //
translated: the exhalation and inhalation of breath through his mouth and nose ceased.🔽When the exhalation and inhalation of breath through his mouth and nose ceased,

original: de'i zhal dang shangs nas dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba bgags pa dang / de'i tshe sku la sku'i gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skyes so //
analyzed: de'i zhal dang shangs nas dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba bgags pa dang / de'i tshe sku la sku'i gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skyes so //
translated: his body was overcome by an unbearable bodily fever.

original: dper na mi shin tu stobs dang ldan pa gnyis kyis mi stobs shin tu chung ba zhig phying ka log tu bzung ste /
analyzed: dper na mi shin tu stobs dang ldan pa gnyis kyis mi stobs shin tu chung ba zhig phying ka log tu bzung ste /
translated: For example, two very strong men might hold down a very weak man on a hot iron plate.

original: me dong gi nang du sbyangs na de'i lus la lus kyi gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: me dong gi nang du sbyangs na de'i lus la lus kyi gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: If they burn him, he will experience unbearable physical pain.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnam par bam pa'i bsam gtan dag la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
translated: In the same way, when the bodhisattvas enter into the concentration of the various kinds of corpses,

original: sku la sku'i gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skyes kyang de zhum pa ma yin gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin /🔽lus ma sbyangs pa ma yin gyi sbyangs pa yin /
analyzed: sku la sku'i gdung ba shin tu mi bzad pa skyes kyang de zhum pa ma yin gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin / lus ma sbyangs pa ma yin gyi sbyangs pa yin /
translated: they experience unbearable physical pain in their bodies, but they are not discouraged; they are full of perseverance.🔽They are not physically exhausted, but are purified.

original: rmugs pa ma yin gyi dran pa nye bar bzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rmugs pa ma yin gyi dran pa nye bar bzhag pa yin te /
translated: They are not sluggish, but are mindful.

original: sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par bzhag pa yin no //
translated: They are in one-pointed meditative equipoise.

original: byang chub sems dpas sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rtsub pa tsha ba yid du mi 'ong ba de lta bu'i tshor ba nyams su myong yang 'di ltar sku bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir thugs yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rtsub pa tsha ba yid du mi 'ong ba de lta bu'i tshor ba nyams su myong yang 'di ltar sku bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir thugs yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so //
translated: Although the Bodhisattva experienced such unbearable, harsh, painful, and unpleasant sensations, he did not give up his practice, for he had trained his body.

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thought to himself:

original: ma la bdag gis thams cad kyi thams cad du zas mi za bar bsgrub par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: ma la bdag gis thams cad kyi thams cad du zas mi za bar bsgrub par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: “Now I will practice complete abstention from food.”

original: de nas lha rab tu mang po'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i thugs shes nas /🔽byang chub sems @31a *//🔽dpa' gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas lha rab tu mang po'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i thugs shes nas / byang chub sems @31a *// dpa' gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then many gods, knowing the Bodhisattva’s thoughts,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: went to the Bodhisattva and said to him:

original: grogs po gal te khyod mi'i kha zas kyis 'dzem par mdzad /
analyzed: grogs po gal te khyod mi'i kha zas kyis 'dzem par mdzad /
translated: “Friend, if you are ashamed of human food,

original: ngo tshab mdzad; smod par mdzad /
analyzed: ngo tshab mdzad; smod par mdzad /
translated: if you are embarrassed by it, if you despise it,

original: rnam par smod par mdzad na /
analyzed: rnam par smod par mdzad na /
translated: if you condemn it,

original: bdag cag gis khyod kyi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas lha'i mdangs bsgrub par bgyis te khyod kyis gtor cig /
analyzed: bdag cag gis khyod kyi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas lha'i mdangs bsgrub par bgyis te khyod kyis gtor cig /
translated: We will restore your divine radiance in all your pores, and you can then scatter it.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought,

original: gal te bdag gis mi'i zas mi za bar dam bcas la bdag gi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad du lha rnams kyis lha'i mdangs bsgrubs nas de bdag gir byed pa ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis mi'i zas mi za bar dam bcas la bdag gi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad du lha rnams kyis lha'i mdangs bsgrubs nas de bdag gir byed pa ni /
translated: “If I were to not eat human food, and if the gods were to restore my divine radiance in all my pores, and if I were to take possession of it,🔽that would be a lie on my part.

original: bdag gi brdzun yin la bdag gi brdzun gang yin pa de ni bdag gi log pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi brdzun yin la bdag gi brdzun gang yin pa de ni bdag gi log pa yin no //
translated: And whatever is a lie on my part is a perversion on my part.

original: bdag gi log pa gang yin pa de'i rkyen gyis 'di na sems can kha cig lus zhig ste /
analyzed: bdag gi log pa gang yin pa de'i rkyen gyis 'di na sems can kha cig lus zhig ste /
translated: And due to that perversion on my part, some beings here, when their bodies break up,

original: shi nas ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: shi nas ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur gyis /
translated: after death, fall into bad rebirths, the lower realms, and are born in the hells.

original: ma la bdag gis lha rnams kyi tshig ni thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs la kha zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung bza' ba'am yang na mon sran snge'u'i khu ba'am /
analyzed: ma la bdag gis lha rnams kyi tshig ni thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs la kha zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung bza' ba'am yang na mon sran snge'u'i khu ba'am /
translated: “I will now completely abandon the words of the gods and eat only a little food, a small amount of food, a tiny amount of food, or a morsel of food, or drink a broth of mung beans,

original: 'on te rgya sran gyi khu ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te rgya sran gyi khu ba'am /
translated: or a broth of lentils,

original: yang na ha re nu ka'i 'bras bu'i khu ba btung snyam mo //
analyzed: yang na ha re nu ka'i 'bras bu'i khu ba btung snyam mo //
translated: or a broth of harītakī fruits.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas de'i tshe lha rnams kyi tshig thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs nas zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang chung zad dang chang chung gsol pa'am /🔽yang na mon sran sde'u'i khu ba'am /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas de'i tshe lha rnams kyi tshig thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs nas zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang chung zad dang chang chung gsol pa'am / yang na mon sran sde'u'i khu ba'am /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva completely abandoned the words of the gods and ate only a little food, a small amount of food, a tiny amount of food, or a morsel of food,🔽or drank a broth of mung beans,

original: 'on te rgya sran gyi khu @31b ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te rgya sran gyi khu @31b ba'am /
translated: or a broth of lentils,

original: yang na ha re nu ka'i 'bras bu'i khu ba gsol lo //
analyzed: yang na ha re nu ka'i 'bras bu'i khu ba gsol lo //
translated: or a broth of harītakī fruits.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang chung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang chung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: Then, as the Bodhisattva ate only a little food, a small amount of food, a tiny amount of food, or a morsel of food,

original: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad zhum kun tu zhum ste /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad zhum kun tu zhum ste /
translated: All his major and minor body parts became sunken and withered.

original: skem zhing dbal chung bar gyur to //
analyzed: skem zhing dbal chung bar gyur to //
translated: He became emaciated and weak.🔽Just as the stems of the asita and kalika plants become shriveled and withered,

original: dper na ldum bu aa si ta'i sdong bu dang / ka li ka'i sdong bu 'jum kun tu 'jum pas sha chung zhing bskams par gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang chung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: dper na ldum bu aa si ta'i sdong bu dang / ka li ka'i sdong bu 'jum kun tu 'jum pas sha chung zhing bskams par gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang chung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: at that time, when the Bodhisattva ate little food,

original: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad zhum kun tu zhum ste /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad zhum kun tu zhum ste /
translated: all his major and minor body parts became sunken and withered.

original: skem zhing dpal chung bar gyur to //
analyzed: skem zhing dpal chung bar gyur to //
translated: He became emaciated and weak.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /🔽dbu la dbu'i pags pa rnyis kun tu rnyis te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na / dbu la dbu'i pags pa rnyis kun tu rnyis te /
translated: Then, when the Bodhisattva ate little food,🔽the skin on his head became wrinkled and withered.

original: 'khums shing 'bar 'bur du gyur to //
analyzed: 'khums shing 'bar 'bur du gyur to //
translated: It became wrinkled and bumpy.

original: dper na ku ba rtsa ba nas bcad na rnyis kun tu rnyis pas 'khums la 'bar 'bur du gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: dper na ku ba rtsa ba nas bcad na rnyis kun tu rnyis pas 'khums la 'bar 'bur du gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: For example, when a pumpkin is cut from its stem, it shrivels up, becomes wrinkled, and develops dents. In the same way, when the bodhisattva ate less and less food,

original: dbu la dbu'i pags pa rnyis kun tu rnyis te /🔽'khums shing 'bar 'bur du gyur kyang /
analyzed: dbu la dbu'i pags pa rnyis kun tu rnyis te / 'khums shing 'bar 'bur du gyur kyang /
translated: the skin on his head became wrinkled and wrinkled all over.🔽It shrank and developed dents.

original: de zhum pa la ma yin gyi brtsen  'grus brtsams pa yin /
analyzed: de zhum pa la ma yin gyi brtsen  'grus brtsams pa yin /
translated: But he was not discouraged. He was full of perseverance.

original: lus ma sbyangs pa ma yin gyi sbyangs pa yin /
analyzed: lus ma sbyangs pa ma yin gyi sbyangs pa yin /
translated: His body was not untrained. It was trained.

original: rmugs pa ma yin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rmugs pa ma yin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
translated: He was not sluggish. He was mindful.

original: sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par bzhag pa yin no //
translated: His mind was in equipoise, one-pointed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i che bdag nyid gnod pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rtsub pa tsha ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor @32a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i che bdag nyid gnod pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rtsub pa tsha ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor @32a *//
translated: The bodhisattva’s great self did not give up on the unbearable, rough, painful, and unpleasant feelings of suffering.

original: ba de lta bu nyams su myong yang 'di ltar sku bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir thugs yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so //
analyzed: ba de lta bu nyams su myong yang 'di ltar sku bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir thugs yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so //
translated: Even though he experienced such things, he did not rest, but rather his mind was completely focused on the practice of the body.

original: de zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: de zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: When he ate little food, small portions, small morsels, and small bites,

original: spyan gnyis kyi spyan gyi 'bras bu phug tu song shin tu phug tu song ste /
analyzed: spyan gnyis kyi spyan gyi 'bras bu phug tu song shin tu phug tu song ste /
translated: the pupils of his eyes sank deep into his head, very deep into his head.

original: zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song bas phyung ba lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song bas phyung ba lta bur snang ngo //
translated: They appeared to have been pulled out, very far, very deep.

original: dper na khron pa zab mo'i chur skar ma'i gzugs brnyan phug tu song shin tu phug song ste /
analyzed: dper na khron pa zab mo'i chur skar ma'i gzugs brnyan phug tu song shin tu phug song ste /
translated: For example, it is like the reflection of a star in the deep water of a well, which sinks deep into the water, very deep into the water.

original: zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song ba gtam du byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song ba gtam du byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: It appears to have been pulled out, very far, very deep.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: In the same way, when the Bodhisattva ate little food, small portions, small morsels, and small bites,

original: spyan gnyis kyi spyan gyi 'bras bu phug tu song shin tu phug tu song ste /
analyzed: spyan gnyis kyi spyan gyi 'bras bu phug tu song shin tu phug tu song ste /
translated: the pupils of his eyes sank deep into his head, very deep into his head.

original: zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song bas phyung ba lta bur snang yang de zhum par ma yin gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin /
analyzed: zab pa shin tu zab par ring du song bas phyung ba lta bur snang yang de zhum par ma yin gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin /
translated: Although it appears as if he has been pulled out from a very deep and extremely deep pit, he is not depressed but has begun to make effort.

original: lus ma sbyangs pa ma yin gyi sbyangs pa yin /
analyzed: lus ma sbyangs pa ma yin gyi sbyangs pa yin /
translated: His body is not untrained but trained.

original: rmugs pa ma yin dran pa nye bar bzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rmugs pa ma yin dran pa nye bar bzhag pa yin te /
translated: He is not sluggish but has established mindfulness.

original: sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par bzhag pa yin no //
translated: He is one-pointedly absorbed in equipoise.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid gnod pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rtsub pa tsha ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor ba de lta bu nyams su myong yang 'di ltar sku bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir thugs yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid gnod pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rtsub pa tsha ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor ba de lta bu nyams su myong yang 'di ltar sku bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir thugs yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so //
translated: At that time, although the Bodhisattva was experiencing such unbearable, harsh, painful, and unpleasant suffering, because he had trained his body in this way, his mind did not become overwhelmed and remain so.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: Then, when the Bodhisattva ate little food, small amounts, a little, and a small portion,

original: de'i tshe rtsib ma'i bar mtho dman can du gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtsib ma'i bar mtho dman can du gyur te /
translated: at that time the spaces between his ribs became high and low.

original: dper na rtsa gang lo gnyis sam lo gsum lon pa'i phyam dgu pa mtho dman du gyur pa de bzhin @32b du /
analyzed: dper na rtsa gang lo gnyis sam lo gsum lon pa'i phyam dgu pa mtho dman du gyur pa de bzhin @32b du /
translated: For example, just as the joints of a two or three year old child are high and low,

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: at that time, when the Bodhisattva ate little food, small food, some food, and very little food,

original: rtsib ma'i bar mtho dman can du gyur kyang /
analyzed: rtsib ma'i bar mtho dman can du gyur kyang /
translated: the joints of his body became high and low.

original: de zhum ba ma yin gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin /
analyzed: de zhum ba ma yin gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin /
translated: But he was not depressed, he was diligent.

original: lus ma sbyangs pa ma yin gyi sbyangs pa yin /
analyzed: lus ma sbyangs pa ma yin gyi sbyangs pa yin /
translated: His body was not untrained, it was trained.

original: rmugs pa ma yin dran pa nye bar bzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rmugs pa ma yin dran pa nye bar bzhag pa yin te /
translated: He was not sluggish, he was mindful.

original: sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par bzhag pa yin no //
translated: His mind was in single-pointed equipoise.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe bdag nyid gnod pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rtsub pa tsha ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor ba de lta bu nyams su myong yang 'di ltar sku bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir thugs yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe bdag nyid gnod pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa rtsub pa tsha ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor ba de lta bu nyams su myong yang 'di ltar sku bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir thugs yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so //
translated: At that time, although the Bodhisattva experienced such unbearable, harsh, painful, and unpleasant feelings of suffering, because his body was trained, his mind did not become exhausted and remain in that state.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhal zas nyung ba dang chung ba dang cung zad dang chang chung gsol ba na /
translated: Then, when the Bodhisattva ate little, less, and very little food,

analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gis btsun mo'i 'khor gyi skye bo thams cad la khrims su bcas pa /

analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /

translated: The urine and dung of those who drink the milk of a cow that has recently given birth.🔽As long as his body did not lose its luster, he did not eat a second meal.

analyzed: dur khrod chen por gshegs nas kyang mi ro dbu rten du bcug /
translated: After going to the great charnel ground, he placed a human corpse under his head,

analyzed: zhabs la zhabs bzhag ste snang ba'i 'du shes dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang / ldang ba'i 'du shes yid la mdzad pas /

analyzed: glo g-yas pas mnal bar mdzad do //

analyzed: rna ba gnyis ka nas 'dren par byed cing 'di skad ces kye phyag dar khrod kyi sha za la ltos /

analyzed: kye phyag dar khrod kyi sha za la ltos zhes smra bar yang byed de //

analyzed: grong khyer gyi gzhon nu ma de rnams la ngan sems bskyed pa'am sdig pa'i tshig dbyung bar mi dgongs so //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu'i dka' ba spyod pa na /
translated: When the Bodhisattva was practicing such austerities,🔽he thought this:

analyzed: 'di snyam du dgongs te /

analyzed: gang su dag sdug bsngal spang par brtson 'grus brtsams par gnas pa de thams cad ni 'di tsam du zad de / de las lhag pa yang med /

original: de'i gong na yang med na /
analyzed: de'i gong na yang med na /
translated: There is nothing higher than this.🔽There is nothing above this.

original: lam 'di yang shes par nus pa ma yin /
analyzed: lam 'di yang shes par nus pa ma yin /

original: mthong bar nus pa ma yin /
analyzed: mthong bar nus pa ma yin /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par nus pa ma yin no @36a *//

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /

analyzed: shes par nus pa dang mthong bar nus pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par nus pa'i lam de gang yin snyam na /
translated: “What is the path that can be known, seen, and fully awakened to?”🔽He thinks this:

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thought this and🔽

analyzed: bdag yang sh'akya zas gtsang gi khyim na gnas pa'i tshe zhing blas kyi mtha'i drung du song nas /
translated: When I was living in the house of Śuddhodana,🔽I went to the edge of the fields.

analyzed: shing 'dzam bu'i grib ma la 'dug ste / 'dod pa las dben pa / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: “When I was living in the Śākya family’s house, I went to the edge of the field and sat in the shade of a rose apple tree.🔽I attained the first concentration, which is free from desires,

analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas shing dpen pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa de mngon par dran te /

original: de ni lam yin /
analyzed: de ni lam yin /

original: de ni bsgrubs pa yin /
analyzed: de ni bsgrubs pa yin /

original: shes par nus pa yin /
analyzed: shes par nus pa yin /
translated: It can be known.

original: mthong bar nus pa yin /
analyzed: mthong bar nus pa yin /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par nus pa yin na /

analyzed: de bdag gis bskyed du yang 'di ltar rid cing nyam chung la zhan pas bla ba ma yin te /

translated: “Well then, I will breathe in and out as I please, eat coarse food of rice and porridge as I please, anoint my body with sesame oil and ghee, and wash my body with warm water.”

analyzed: sku til mar dang mar sar gyis byugs nas chu 'jam pos sku 'khru bar mdzad do //// 'dul ba gzhi / bam po gya lnga pa /

analyzed: de nas rim gro pa lnga po de rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The five attendants thought,

original: shes ldan dag /
analyzed: shes ldan dag /
translated: “Friends,

analyzed: dge sbyong go'u ta ma 'di ni sdom pa lhod pa / bya ba mang ba /

analyzed: mang pos 'tsho ba /
translated: has many activities,🔽lives in the company of many people,

original: spong ba nyams par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: spong ba nyams par gyur pa yin te /

original: chu 'jam pos lus khrus byed de /
analyzed: chu 'jam pos lus khrus byed de /
translated: He bathes his body with warm water.

original: 'dis da ni cung zad kyang thob par mi nus so snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: 'dis da ni cung zad kyang thob par mi nus so snyam du bsams nas /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bor te dong ba las /

translated: The five of them are in agreement, get along, and are completely happy. Without dispute, they live in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana. Because of this, they are called the “group of five.”

translated: The Bodhisattva gradually develops the strength, power, and diligence of his body. In due course, he arrives at the city of Campā.

analyzed: de na grong khyer gyi dpon po sde can zhes bya ba de la bu mo gnyis yod de /

original: dga' mo dang dga' stobs ma'o //
analyzed: dga' mo dang dga' stobs ma'o //
translated: Nanda and Nandabalā.

original: de gnyis kyis sh'akya rnams kyi gzhon nu /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis sh'akya rnams kyi gzhon nu /
translated: They heard that a young man of the Śākya clan

analyzed: gangs ri'i ngos chu bo skal ldan shing rta'i 'gram drang srong ser skya'i bsti gnas dang ha cang yang mi ring bar byung ba de /

analyzed: mtshan mkhan dang ltas mkhan gyi bram ze rnams kyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pa de yang gzugs bzang ba /
translated: The brahmins who were astrologers and augurs had prophesied that he would become a universal monarch.🔽He was handsome,

original: @37a *// blta na sdug pa mdzes pa /
analyzed: @37a *// blta na sdug pa mdzes pa /
translated: beautiful to behold,

original: mtshan thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mtshan thams cad dang ldan pa /

original: skye bo thams cad kyi yid 'phrog pa yin pas bud med gang gis lo bcu gnyis su 'di lta bu'i brtul zhugs yang dag par blangs te spyod pa de'i khyim thab tu 'gyur ro zhes thos so //

translated: They heard that any woman who undertook such an observance for twelve years would become his wife.

analyzed: thos nas kyang bud med ni skyes pa la mngon par dga' ba yin pas de nyid kyis lo bcu gnyis su dka' thub blangs te /
translated: Having heard this, the woman, who was attached to men, took up the ascetic practice for twelve years.

original: de rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: When she had completed it,

translated: she offered to the sage who was exhausted by his austerities, and who had just arrived, a drink of milk that had been boiled sixteen times and was as sweet as honey.

analyzed: de gnyis kyis ba stong bzhos nas ba stong po de nyid la blud do //

analyzed: de nas ba stong po de nyid la bzhos nas lnga brgya la blud do //

analyzed: de nas lnga brgya po dag bzhos nas lnga brgya po de dag nyid la blud do //

analyzed: de nas lnga brgya po de dag nyid bzhos nas nyis brgya lnga bcu la blud do //

analyzed: de nas nyis brgya lnga bcu po de dag nyid bzhos nas nyis brgya lnga bcu de dag nyid la blud do //
translated: Then they milked those two hundred and fifty cows and gave the milk to those same two hundred and fifty cows.

original: de nas nyis brgya lnga bcu po de dag nyid bzhos nas /
analyzed: de nas nyis brgya lnga bcu po de dag nyid bzhos nas /
translated: Then, having milked those two hundred and fifty,

analyzed: brgya nyi shu rtsa lnga la blud do //
translated: he milked one hundred and twenty-five.

analyzed: de nas brgya nyi shu rtsa lnga po de dag bzhos nas brgya nyi shu rtsa lnga po de dag nyid la blud do //
translated: Then, having milked those one hundred and twenty-five, he milked one hundred and twenty-five.

analyzed: de nas brgya nyi shu rtsa lnga po de dag bzhos nas drug cu rtsa gsum dag la blud do //

analyzed: de nas drug cu rtsa gsum po de dag bzhos nas drug cu rtsa gsum po de dag nyid la blud do //
translated: Then, having milked those sixty-three, he milked sixty-three.

analyzed: de nas drug cu rtsa gsum po de dag bzhos nas sum cu @37b rtsa gnyis la blud do //
translated: Then, having milked those sixty-three, he milked thirty-two.

original: de nas sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag bzhos te sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag nyid la blud do //
analyzed: de nas sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag bzhos te sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag nyid la blud do //

analyzed: de nas sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag nyid bzhos nas bcu drug la blud do //

analyzed: de nas bcu drug po de dag nyid bzhos nas bcu drug po de dag nyid la blud do //
translated: Then, having milked those sixteen, he milked sixteen.

original: de nas bcu drug po de dag nyid bzhos nas brgyad la blud do //
analyzed: de nas bcu drug po de dag nyid bzhos nas brgyad la blud do //
translated: Then, having milked those sixteen, he milked the eight.

original: de nas brgyad po de dag nyid bzhos nas brgyad po de dag nyid la blud do //
analyzed: de nas brgyad po de dag nyid bzhos nas brgyad po de dag nyid la blud do //
translated: Then, having milked those eight, he milked the eight.

analyzed: de nas brgyad po de dag nyid lan bcu drug tu nying khur byas pa bzhos te /
translated: Then, having milked those eight sixteen times, he made a cream.

original: shel las byas pa'i snod kyi nang du blugs nas bskol te 'o thug sbrang rtsi ltar mngar bar byed pa na /
analyzed: shel las byas pa'i snod kyi nang du blugs nas bskol te 'o thug sbrang rtsi ltar mngar bar byed pa na /
translated: Having poured it into a crystal vessel, he heated it and made it as sweet as honey.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis bsams pa /
translated: The gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm thought,

analyzed: 'o ma'i thug pa 'di byang chub sems dpas gsol na /
translated: “If the Bodhisattva drinks this milk,

analyzed: deng nyid du bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur gyi sa de lta bas na 'di la mthu zhig bstab par bya'o snyam nas /
