original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag 'khor lo dang / bkra shis dang g-yung drung 'khyil pa dang / dra bas 'brel pa bsod nams brgya phrag du mas bskyed pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag 'khor lo dang / bkra shis dang g-yung drung 'khyil pa dang / dra bas 'brel pa bsod nams brgya phrag du mas bskyed pa /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, with his hands, which were marked with wheels, auspicious signs, swastikas, and nets, and which had been produced by many hundreds of merits,

original: skrag pa rnams la dbugs 'byin par mdzad pas sa la reg par mdzad nas /🔽ngas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du mchod sbyin bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma byas shing sems can rnams kyi phyir mgo dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang / sha dang / khrag dang / bu dang /
analyzed: skrag pa rnams la dbugs 'byin par mdzad pas sa la reg par mdzad nas / ngas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du mchod sbyin bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma byas shing sems can rnams kyi phyir mgo dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang / sha dang / khrag dang / bu dang /
translated: He touched the earth to inspire confidence in those who were afraid.🔽“This is my witness that for three incalculable eons I have made many quintillions of sacrifices, and for the sake of sentient beings I have given away my head,🔽hands, feet, eyes, flesh, blood, children,

original: chung ma dang / dbyig dang / gser la sogs pa yongs su btang ba'i nga'i dpang ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: chung ma dang / dbyig dang / gser la sogs pa yongs su btang ba'i nga'i dpang ni 'di yin no //
translated: wife, silver, gold, and so on.”

original: de nas sa'i lhas sa brtol nas thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas sa'i lhas sa brtol nas thal mo sbyar te /
translated: Then the earth goddess rose up from the earth and, with palms together,🔽she cried out, “Evil one, it is just as the Blessed One has said!”

original: skad phyung nas sdig can bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad bka' stsal pa de de bzhin no zhes de skad smras pa dang / bdud sdig can cang mi smra bar gyur te /🔽zhum zhum por gyur /
analyzed: skad phyung nas sdig can bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad bka' stsal pa de de bzhin no zhes de skad smras pa dang / bdud sdig can cang mi smra bar gyur te / zhum zhum por gyur /
translated: When she said this, Māra the evil one became silent,🔽depressed,

original: bag 'khums par gyur //
analyzed: bag 'khums par gyur //
translated: and dejected.

original: spyi bo smad nas spobs pa med la sems khong du chud cing 'dug par gyur te /
analyzed: spyi bo smad nas spobs pa med la sems khong du chud cing 'dug par gyur te /
translated: With his head down, he had no confidence and sat there with his mind withdrawn.

original: de sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bas bsams pa /
analyzed: de sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bas bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: bdag gis sh'akya zas gtsang gi bu la de ltar byas kyang glags ma rnyed kyis /
analyzed: bdag gis sh'akya zas gtsang gi bu la de ltar byas kyang glags ma rnyed kyis /
translated: “Although I have done this to the son of Śuddhodana, I have not found an opportunity.

original: ma la 'di la bdag gis yang bgegs @43a *//
analyzed: ma la 'di la bdag gis yang bgegs @43a *//
translated: Mother, I will create another obstacle for him.”

original: shig bya'o zhes smras nas song ngo //
analyzed: shig bya'o zhes smras nas song ngo //
translated: Having said this, he left.

original: de nas des bu mo gsum po sred ma dang / dga' byed ma dang / dga' spyod ma mngags te /
analyzed: de nas des bu mo gsum po sred ma dang / dga' byed ma dang / dga' spyod ma mngags te /
translated: Then he sent three women, Nandā, Nandabalā, and Sahajā,

original: de rnams gzugs dang / lang tsho'i rgyags pas dregs shing /
analyzed: de rnams gzugs dang / lang tsho'i rgyags pas dregs shing /
translated: who were arrogant with the pride of their beauty and youth,

original: lha'i gos dang rgyan gyis klubs nas /
analyzed: lha'i gos dang rgyan gyis klubs nas /
translated: adorned with divine garments and ornaments,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mdun du bud med kyi g-yo rnams bstan par brtsams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mdun du bud med kyi g-yo rnams bstan par brtsams so //
translated: and they began to display their feminine wiles in front of the Bodhisattva.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, skilled in means,

original: ji ltar rgan mor gyur pa de ltar byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: ji ltar rgan mor gyur pa de ltar byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: blessed them so that they became old women.

original: bdud gang na ba der dong ba dang / bdud kyi bu mo rnams de lta bu'i rnam par mthong nas yi chad nas lag pa la 'gram pa gtad de gang gis na sh'akya zas gtsang gi bu dka' thub la bgegs byed par 'gyur ba'i thabs legs pa ci yod snyam nas sems khong du chud cing 'dug
analyzed: bdud gang na ba der dong ba dang / bdud kyi bu mo rnams de lta bu'i rnam par mthong nas yi chad nas lag pa la 'gram pa gtad de gang gis na sh'akya zas gtsang gi bu dka' thub la bgegs byed par 'gyur ba'i thabs legs pa ci yod snyam nas sems khong du chud cing 'dug
translated: They were despondent. They put their hands to their cheeks and thought, “What is the best way to create obstacles for the ascetic, the son of Śuddhodana?” They sat there with their minds troubled.

original: go / des 'byung po'i dpung tshogs dang ldan pa /🔽glang po che dang / rta dang / rnga mo dang / ra dang / ri dvags dang / ma he dang / phag dang / khyi dang / 'ug pa dang / ne'u le dang / spre'u dang / wa la sogs pa 'dra ba ral gri dang /
analyzed: go / des 'byung po'i dpung tshogs dang ldan pa / glang po che dang / rta dang / rnga mo dang / ra dang / ri dvags dang / ma he dang / phag dang / khyi dang / 'ug pa dang / ne'u le dang / spre'u dang / wa la sogs pa 'dra ba ral gri dang /
translated: He had an army of bhūta spirits.🔽They were like elephants, horses, camels, goats, deer, buffaloes, pigs, dogs, owls, mongooses, monkeys, foxes, and so on. They had swords,

original: mda' bo che dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / 'khor lo dang / mdung thung dang / gzhu dang / zhags pa dang / dgra sta dang / lcags kyi ber ka la sogs te mtshon cha can /
analyzed: mda' bo che dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / 'khor lo dang / mdung thung dang / gzhu dang / zhags pa dang / dgra sta dang / lcags kyi ber ka la sogs te mtshon cha can /
translated: spears, single-pointed weapons, discuses, javelins, bows, lassos, axes, iron cudgels, and so on. They had weapons.

original: bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug ded nas rang nyid gzhu rna drung du bkang ste /
analyzed: bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug ded nas rang nyid gzhu rna drung du bkang ste /
translated: He was surrounded by thirty-six million of his own people, and he himself was holding his bow to his ear.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su bskor nas 'dug go /🔽de nas byang chub sems dpas gzugs rnam pa du ma can /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su bskor nas 'dug go / de nas byang chub sems dpas gzugs rnam pa du ma can /
translated: He was sitting there, completely surrounding the Bodhisattva.🔽Then the Bodhisattva saw that they had many different kinds of forms,

original: mtshon cha @43b rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dang bcas pa de rnams gzigs nas dgongs pa /
analyzed: mtshon cha @43b rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dang bcas pa de rnams gzigs nas dgongs pa /
translated: and that they had many different kinds of weapons.

original: re zhig pho phal pa zhig dang lhan cig 'thab par brtson na yang de'i gnyen po'i phyogs la sbyor ba byed na //
analyzed: re zhig pho phal pa zhig dang lhan cig 'thab par brtson na yang de'i gnyen po'i phyogs la sbyor ba byed na //
translated: He thought, “If I were to strive to fight with just one ordinary man, I would have to apply an antidote to him.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug 'di la lta smos kyang ci dgos kyis /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug 'di la lta smos kyang ci dgos kyis /
translated: What need is there to mention this lord of the desire realm?

original: ma la bdag gis gnyen po'i phyogs la sbyar bar bya'o snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: ma la bdag gis gnyen po'i phyogs la sbyar bar bya'o snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: Therefore, I will apply an antidote to him.”

original: de zhi bar 'gyur ba'i thabs la dgongs par brtsams so //
analyzed: de zhi bar 'gyur ba'i thabs la dgongs par brtsams so //
translated: He thought about the method that would pacify him.

original: bdud kyang 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug dang lhan cig tu byang chub sems dpa'i steng nas 'khor lo dang / mdung dang / mda' bo che dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / mda' la sogs te mtshon cha rnams dbab par brtsams so //
analyzed: bdud kyang 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug dang lhan cig tu byang chub sems dpa'i steng nas 'khor lo dang / mdung dang / mda' bo che dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / mda' la sogs te mtshon cha rnams dbab par brtsams so //
translated: Māra, together with thirty-six million bhūtas, then began to rain down upon the Bodhisattva wheels, spears, javelins, tridents, arrows, and other weapons.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva entered the meditative absorption of loving kindness.

original: de'i tshe mtshon cha de rnams lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang; ku mu ta dang / padma dkar por gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshon cha de rnams lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang; ku mu ta dang / padma dkar por gyur nas /
translated: At that moment, the weapons turned into divine flowers such as utpala, padma, kumuda, and puṇḍarīka,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nye 'khor du 'bab par brtsams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nye 'khor du 'bab par brtsams so //
translated: and began to fall around the Bodhisattva.

original: de nas bdud steng gi bar snang la mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: de nas bdud steng gi bar snang la mngon par 'phags te /
translated: Māra then rose up into the sky above and

original: phyag dar gyi char dbab par brtsams na /
analyzed: phyag dar gyi char dbab par brtsams na /
translated: began to rain down a storm of dust.

original: de yang lha'i me tog manda ra ba rnams su gyur nas /
analyzed: de yang lha'i me tog manda ra ba rnams su gyur nas /
translated: That too turned into divine mandārava flowers,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i steng nas 'bab par brtsams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i steng nas 'bab par brtsams so //
translated: and began to fall upon the Bodhisattva.

original: de nas bdud kyis gdug pa'i rlung dang / rdo'i char phab pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa'i steng du lo ma las ma yin pa'i spyil bo mngon par sprul pas rdo'i char dang gdug pa'i rlung du bcas pa des byang chub sems @44a *//
analyzed: de nas bdud kyis gdug pa'i rlung dang / rdo'i char phab pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa'i steng du lo ma las ma yin pa'i spyil bo mngon par sprul pas rdo'i char dang gdug pa'i rlung du bcas pa des byang chub sems @44a *//
translated: Then the demons unleashed a violent wind and a rain of stones, but the gods of the Pure Abodes magically created a leaf-roof above the Bodhisattva, and the rain of stones and the violent wind did not reach him.🔽

original: dpa' la cung zad kyang gnod par ma gyur to //
analyzed: dpa' la cung zad kyang gnod par ma gyur to //
translated: Then Māra sent forth a violent wind and a rain of stones, and the gods of the Pure Abodes magically created a leaf-hut above the Bodhisattva. The rain of stones and the violent wind did not harm the Bodhisattva in the least.

original: bdud kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: bdud kyis bsams pa /
translated: Māra thought,

original: bdag gis nam du yongs su bskor te 'dug /
analyzed: bdag gis nam du yongs su bskor te 'dug /
translated: “When will I be able to sit surrounded by my retinue?”

original: bsam gtan gyi tsher ma ni sgra yin gyis /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi tsher ma ni sgra yin gyis /
translated: “Sound is the thorn of concentration.

original: byang chub kyi shing shel las byas par mngon par sprul la song ba dang / de'i lo ma rnams rtag par sgra 'byin pas de'i sems rtse gcig par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing shel las byas par mngon par sprul la song ba dang / de'i lo ma rnams rtag par sgra 'byin pas de'i sems rtse gcig par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: I will transform the Bodhi tree into crystal and go there. Since its leaves will always make a sound, his mind will not be one-pointed.”

original: byang chub kyi shing shel las byas par mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing shel las byas par mngon par sprul te /
translated: He transformed the Bodhi tree into crystal.

original: rna ba gtad nas bsgrims te bsdad pa na /
analyzed: rna ba gtad nas bsgrims te bsdad pa na /
translated: He listened intently,

original: byang chub kyi shing gi lo ma shel las byas pa rnams myur ba myur bar sgra 'byin par brtsams pas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing gi lo ma shel las byas pa rnams myur ba myur bar sgra 'byin par brtsams pas /
translated: The leaves of the Bodhi tree, made of crystal, began to make a sound.

original: bsam gtan gyi tsher ma ni sgra yin pas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi tsher ma ni sgra yin pas /
translated: Sound is a thorn to meditation.

original: byang chub sems dpas sems rtse gcig pa ma thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sems rtse gcig pa ma thob bo //
translated: The Bodhisattva did not attain one-pointed mind.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis bsams pa /
translated: The gods of the Pure Abodes thought,

original: shel las byas pa'i byang chub kyi shing gi lo ma rnams kyi sgras byang chub sems dpa' sems rtse gcig pa ma thob kyis thabs shig bsham par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: shel las byas pa'i byang chub kyi shing gi lo ma rnams kyi sgras byang chub sems dpa' sems rtse gcig pa ma thob kyis thabs shig bsham par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: “The sound of the leaves of the Bodhi tree made of crystal has prevented the Bodhisattva from attaining one-pointed mind. We must devise a means.”

original: de nas de rnams kyis lo ma re re bzung na 'on kyang bdud kyi dpung de bzhin du gnas nas /
analyzed: de nas de rnams kyis lo ma re re bzung na 'on kyang bdud kyi dpung de bzhin du gnas nas /
translated: Then they each took a leaf, but still the army of Māra remained as before.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis bsams pa /
translated: The gods of the Pure Abodes thought,

original: bdud sdig can ni ring mo zhig tu byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par 'tshe bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas bdud kyi dpung de khor yug gi pha rol tu 'phangs so //
analyzed: bdud sdig can ni ring mo zhig tu byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par 'tshe bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas bdud kyi dpung de khor yug gi pha rol tu 'phangs so //
translated: “The evil Māra will harm the Bodhisattva for a long time.” Thinking this, they threw Māra’s army to the other side of the outer ring of mountains.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas nas 'bab chu chen po ne ranydza na'i 'gram byang chub kyi shing drung du bzhugs @44b te; rtag tu bya ba dang / 'grus skyong dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas nas 'bab chu chen po ne ranydza na'i 'gram byang chub kyi shing drung du bzhugs @44b te; rtag tu bya ba dang / 'grus skyong dang ldan zhing /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, the Blessed One, was dwelling in the vicinity of the great river Nairañjanā, in the field of the Bodhi tree, in the place of the Awakening, always engaged in activity, and endowed with diligence.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su brtson pas bzhugs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su brtson pas bzhugs so //
translated: He was dwelling there, engaged in the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening.

original: de nam gyi thun dang po la rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na /
analyzed: de nam gyi thun dang po la rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na /
translated: In the first watch of the night, he directed his mind to the supernormal knowledge that is the direct realization of the object of supernormal power.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi yul rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi yul rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar mdzad de /
translated: He experienced many kinds of supernormal powers.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: gcig tu gyur cing mang por gyur la /
analyzed: gcig tu gyur cing mang por gyur la /
translated: he became one and then many,

original: mang por gyur cing gcig tu gyur pa dang / snang bar gyur cing mi snang bar gyur pa ye shes gzigs pas nyams su myong bar mdzad do //
analyzed: mang por gyur cing gcig tu gyur pa dang / snang bar gyur cing mi snang bar gyur pa ye shes gzigs pas nyams su myong bar mdzad do //
translated: and many and then one again, and he experienced the vision of wisdom that is to say, he became visible and then invisible.

original: skus rtsig pa dang ri dang ra ba la yang thad kar gshegs par mdzad de /
analyzed: skus rtsig pa dang ri dang ra ba la yang thad kar gshegs par mdzad de /
translated: His body directly passed through walls, mountains, and ramparts.

original: dper na nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no //🔽sa la yang steng du 'byung ba dang / ji zul mdzad de /🔽dper na chu la bya ba bzhin no //🔽chu'i rgyun la yang mi nyams par gshegs te /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no // sa la yang steng du 'byung ba dang / ji zul mdzad de / dper na chu la bya ba bzhin no // chu'i rgyun la yang mi nyams par gshegs te /
translated: He can even pass through walls, mountains, and ramparts as if through space.🔽He can walk on water without breaking through it as if on earth.

original: dper na sa la bya ba bzhin no //🔽nam mkha' la yang skyil mo krung gis gshegs par mdzad de /
analyzed: dper na sa la bya ba bzhin no // nam mkha' la yang skyil mo krung gis gshegs par mdzad de /
translated: He can even dive into the earth and emerge from it as if in water.

original: dper na 'dab chags bya bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dab chags bya bzhin no //
translated: He can travel cross-legged through the sky like a bird on the wing.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba 'di ltar gzigs brjid che ba yang phyag gis nom zhing nyug par mdzad cing tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du sku'i dbang sgyur bar mdzad do //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba 'di ltar gzigs brjid che ba yang phyag gis nom zhing nyug par mdzad cing tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du sku'i dbang sgyur bar mdzad do //
translated: He can touch and stroke with his hand the moon and sun, powerful and majestic though they are, and he can even exercise mastery over the body as far as the Brahma world.

original: yang bdud kyis bsams pa; bsam gtan gyi tsher ma ni sgra yin pas /
analyzed: yang bdud kyis bsams pa; bsam gtan gyi tsher ma ni sgra yin pas /
translated: Mara thought, “Sound is the thorn of meditation.

original: ma la bdag gis rgyang ring po kho nar 'dug la sgra dbyung bar bya'o snyam nas /🔽des 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug dang / 'jigs pa chen po 'jigs @45a *//
analyzed: ma la bdag gis rgyang ring po kho nar 'dug la sgra dbyung bar bya'o snyam nas / des 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug dang / 'jigs pa chen po 'jigs @45a *//
translated: “I will stay far away and make a sound.”

original: su rung ba'i sgra phyung ngo //
analyzed: su rung ba'i sgra phyung ngo //
translated: He made a terrifying sound that frightened thirty-six million spirits.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang de sgrib pa'i phyir dpag tshad bcu gnyis kyi bar du shing ka dam pa'i tshal sprul pas des na sgra de rdug pas mi grags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang de sgrib pa'i phyir dpag tshad bcu gnyis kyi bar du shing ka dam pa'i tshal sprul pas des na sgra de rdug pas mi grags so //
translated: The Bodhisattva emanated a forest of kadamba trees twelve leagues away to muffle the sound.

original: byang chub sems dpas dgongs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas dgongs pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva thought,

original: ma la bdag gis lha'i rna ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la sems mngon du bzhag nas /
analyzed: ma la bdag gis lha'i rna ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la sems mngon du bzhag nas /
translated: “I will focus my mind on the supernormal knowledge of divine hearing.

original: des na lha dang mi rnams kyi sgra gang dang gang dag thos par 'dod pa de dag mnyan par bya'o snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: des na lha dang mi rnams kyi sgra gang dang gang dag thos par 'dod pa de dag mnyan par bya'o snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: I will listen to whatever sounds I wish to hear, whether of gods or humans.”

original: lha'i rna ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa bzhag pa na /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa bzhag pa na /
translated: He focused his mind on the supernormal knowledge of divine hearing.

original: de lha'i snyan rnam par dag pa mi rnams kyi las 'das pas /
analyzed: de lha'i snyan rnam par dag pa mi rnams kyi las 'das pas /
translated: His divine hearing, which surpasses that of humans,

original: sgra gnyis po mi rnams kyi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams kyi dang / gang dag ring ba dang / gang dag nye ba yang gsan to //
analyzed: sgra gnyis po mi rnams kyi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams kyi dang / gang dag ring ba dang / gang dag nye ba yang gsan to //
translated: hears both human and non-human sounds, whether they are far or near.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas dgongs pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas dgongs pa /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought,

original: bdud kyi 'khor 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug las bdag la su dag ni gnod par sems /
analyzed: bdud kyi 'khor 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug las bdag la su dag ni gnod par sems /
translated: “Among the thirty-six million māras and spirits, who is thinking of harming me

original: su dag ni ma yin zhes de dag ji ltar shes par bya snyam pa dang / de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: su dag ni ma yin zhes de dag ji ltar shes par bya snyam pa dang / de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: and who is not?” He thought, “How can I know this?”

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yin no snyam nas /
translated: He thought, “This is the supernormal knowledge of directly perceiving the knowledge of others’ minds.”

original: de nam gyi gung thun la sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na /
analyzed: de nam gyi gung thun la sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na /
translated: In the middle part of the night, he focused his mind on the supernormal knowledge of directly perceiving the knowledge of others’ minds.

original: de'i thugs kyis sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i yid ji lta ba @45b bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: de'i thugs kyis sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i yid ji lta ba @45b bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: His mind knows the thoughts and mental activity of other sentient beings and other persons just as they are.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems so zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems so zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows a mind with passion just as it is as a mind with passion.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems so zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems so zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows a mind without passion just as it is as a mind without passion.

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / rgod pa dang /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / rgod pa dang /
translated: He knows a mind with aversion, without aversion, with confusion, without confusion, contracted, distracted, depressed, pumped up,

original: mi rgod pa dang / nye bar ma zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / ma bsgoms pa dang / bsgom pa dang / sems rnam par ma grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mi rgod pa dang / nye bar ma zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / ma bsgoms pa dang / bsgom pa dang / sems rnam par ma grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is: who are not tamed, who are tamed, who are not at peace, who are at peace, who are not concentrated, who are concentrated, who have not cultivated, who have cultivated, who have not liberated their minds, and who have liberated their minds.

original: shin tu rnam par grol ba'i sems la shin tu rnam par grol ba'i sems so zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par grol ba'i sems la shin tu rnam par grol ba'i sems so zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is: who have minds that are completely liberated, that they have minds that are completely liberated.

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thinks:

original: bdud kyi mngag gzhug pa 'di rnams las su dag bdag dang / tshe rabs gzhan na mar 'brel ba'am /🔽phar 'brel ba'am /
analyzed: bdud kyi mngag gzhug pa 'di rnams las su dag bdag dang / tshe rabs gzhan na mar 'brel ba'am / phar 'brel ba'am /
translated: “From among these servants of Māra, who are related to me in this life or in other lives,

original: su dag gshed ma'am /
analyzed: su dag gshed ma'am /
translated: who are my enemies,

original: phyir rgol ba dang / dgrar gyur pa de dag ji ltar shes par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba dang / dgrar gyur pa de dag ji ltar shes par bya snyam mo //
translated: who are my adversaries, and who are my foes? How can I know this?”

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thinks:🔽“I will know this through the power of wisdom.”

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yin no snyam nas /
translated: “This is the supernormal knowledge of the knowledge of the recollection of past lives.”

original: de nam gyi gung thun la sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du gzhag pa @46a *//
analyzed: de nam gyi gung thun la sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du gzhag pa @46a *//
translated: When he had settled on the supernormal knowledge of the knowledge of the recollection of past lives in the middle part of the night,

original: na; des sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dgongs te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: na; des sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dgongs te / 'di lta ste /

original: des skye ba gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang /
analyzed: des skye ba gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dang / dgu dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang /
translated: He recollected one life, two lives, three lives, four lives, five lives, six lives, seven lives, eight lives, nine lives, ten lives, twenty lives, thirty lives, forty lives, fifty lives,

original: skye ba brgya dang / skye ba stong dang / skye ba brgya phrag du ma dang / skye ba stong phrag du ma dang; skye ba brgya stong phrag du ma dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa dang / chags pa'i bskal pa dang / 'jig pa dang /
analyzed: skye ba brgya dang / skye ba stong dang / skye ba brgya phrag du ma dang / skye ba stong phrag du ma dang; skye ba brgya stong phrag du ma dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa dang / chags pa'i bskal pa dang / 'jig pa dang /
translated: many hundreds of thousands of lives,🔽ages of dissolution,🔽ages of evolution,🔽ages of both dissolution and evolution,🔽many ages of dissolution,🔽many ages of evolution,

original: chags pa'i bskal pa dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma dang / chags pa'i bskal pa du ma dang / 'jig pa dang / chags pa'i bskal pa du ma rjes su dgongs te /
analyzed: chags pa'i bskal pa dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma dang / chags pa'i bskal pa du ma dang / 'jig pa dang / chags pa'i bskal pa du ma rjes su dgongs te /
translated: and many ages of both dissolution and evolution.

original: bdag sngon sems can 'di dag gi nang na gnas pa na ming ni 'di zhes bya /🔽rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag sngon sems can 'di dag gi nang na gnas pa na ming ni 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: “I was born in such and such a place,🔽in such and such a family,

original: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: in such and such a caste,

original: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: kha zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /

analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig nyams su myong / tshe ni 'di srid cig lon /

analyzed: yun ni 'di srid cig 'dug 'dug ;tshe 'di srid cig lon te gnas de nas bdag shi 'phos te /
translated: living for such and such a long time, and then I died and transmigrated from that place.

analyzed: che ge mo zhig tu skyes so // de nas kyang shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //

analyzed: de nas kyang shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes bya ba rnam pa dang bcas /
translated: After that, he died and was born here.

analyzed: yul phyogs dang bcas pas sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dgongs so //
translated: In this way, he recollects his many previous abodes with their aspects and locations.

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thinks to himself:

analyzed: bdud kyi mngag gzhug 'di @46b rnams las su dag ni ngan song du 'gro /
translated: “From among these messengers of Māra, who will go to the lower realms?

original: su dag ni mi 'gro ba de dag ji ltar shes par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: su dag ni mi 'gro ba de dag ji ltar shes par bya snyam mo //
translated: Who will not go? How can I know this?”

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thinks to himself:🔽“This is the supernormal knowledge of knowing death and rebirth.”

original: 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yin no snyam ste de nam gyi thun tha ma la 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yin no snyam ste de nam gyi thun tha ma la 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na /
translated: When he directs his mind to the supernormal knowledge of knowing death and rebirth in the last watch of the night,

analyzed: de'i lha'i spyan rnam par dag pa mi rnams kyi las 'das pas gzigs na /
translated: With his divine eye, which is pure and surpasses that of humans, he sees beings passing away and being born: inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in happy and miserable conditions.

original: sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dang / kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa dang / dman pa dang gya nom pa dang / bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i sems can rnams las ji lta ba bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba /

translated: He sees beings going to a good or bad rebirth according to their deeds.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /🔽shes ldan sems can 'di zhes bya ba 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan; ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te / shes ldan sems can 'di zhes bya ba 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan; ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan te /
translated: He fully understands it as it really is.🔽‘These beings, who have engaged in misconduct by body,

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa log par lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa log par lta ba ste /
translated: speech, and mind, who have abused the noble ones, and who have wrong views,

original: log par lta ba'i chos dang las yang dag par bslangs pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i chos dang las yang dag par bslangs pa'i rgyus /
translated: have, because of their wrong views and deeds,

analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to that cause and that condition, when their bodies give out, after they die, they will be born in the lower realms, in the bad places, in the realms of hell beings.

original: shes ldan sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: shes ldan sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan /
translated: “‘These sentient beings have good physical conduct,

original: ngag dang yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan te /
translated: good verbal conduct, and good mental conduct.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa mi 'debs shing yang dag par lta ba ste /🔽yang dag par lta ba'i chos dang las yang dag @47a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa mi 'debs shing yang dag par lta ba ste / yang dag par lta ba'i chos dang las yang dag @47a *//
translated: They do not slander the noble ones, and they have right views.

original: par blangs pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: par blangs pa'i rgyus /
translated: Because of having taken up the Dharma and actions with right views,

original: rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: due to that cause and that condition, when their bodies give out, after they die, they will be born in a good place, in the higher realms, in the company of gods and humans.’

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thought this and then thought further:

original: shes ldan sems can 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pas 'khor ba na 'khor ro //
analyzed: shes ldan sems can 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pas 'khor ba na 'khor ro //
translated: ‘These sentient beings circle in saṃsāra because of the defilement of desire, the defilement of existence, and the defilement of ignorance.’

original: 'di rnams kyi 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa de ji ltar spang ba ji ltar shes par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa de ji ltar spang ba ji ltar shes par bya snyam mo //
translated: How should I know how to abandon the defilements of desire, the defilements of existence, and the defilements of ignorance?”

original: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thought this and then thought:

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yin no snyam ste /
translated: “It is the supernormal knowledge of the direct realization of the knowledge of the exhaustion of the defilements.”

original: de rtag tu byed pa dang / 'grus skyong dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de rtag tu byed pa dang / 'grus skyong dang ldan zhing /
translated: He was always active and diligent,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su brtson par gnas nas zag pa med pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na /🔽des 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rjes su brtson par gnas nas zag pa med pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la dgongs pa mngon du bzhag pa na / des 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: and while abiding in the practice of the factors of awakening, he focused his mind on the supernormal knowledge of the direct realization of the knowledge of the exhaustion of the defilements.

original: zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: He knew it as it really is:🔽“This is the noble truth of suffering.🔽This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: This is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: de de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: “When one knows and sees thus, the mind is liberated from the defilement of desire,

original: srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa @47b las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa @47b las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: from the defilement of existence, and from the defilement of ignorance.

original: rnam par grol ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba nas /
translated: “When it is liberated, there arises the knowledge that it is liberated.

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: ‘My births have been exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la brten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la brten to //
translated: I have practiced the holy life.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what had to be done.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes rnam par grol ba'i ye shes nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes rnam par grol ba'i ye shes nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I will know no other existence than this.

original: de ltar de na bcom ldan 'das byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de ltar de na bcom ldan 'das byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: ’ “Thus, the Blessed One, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: bya ba byas /
analyzed: bya ba byas /
translated: having done what had to be done,

original: byed pa byas nas me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: byed pa byas nas me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: entered the fire element and entered meditative absorption.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpas bdud kyi 'khor 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug byams pa'i mtshon gyis mngon du bcom nas bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa'i tshe bdud sdig can gyi lag nas gzhu lhung /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpas bdud kyi 'khor 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug byams pa'i mtshon gyis mngon du bcom nas bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa'i tshe bdud sdig can gyi lag nas gzhu lhung /
translated: When the Bodhisattva had conquered with the weapon of love the thirty-six koṭis of demons and had attained supreme knowledge, the bow of the evil one fell from his hands.

original: rgyal mtshan 'gyel /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan 'gyel /
translated: His banner fell.

original: gnas kyang g-yos so //
analyzed: gnas kyang g-yos so //
translated: His abode shook.

original: de nas bdud sdig can nam 'byung po'i 'khor bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde ba yid la gcags te /
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can nam 'byung po'i 'khor bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde ba yid la gcags te /
translated: Then the evil one, with his thirty-six koṭis of demons, was miserable, unhappy, and remorseful.

original: de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: He disappeared right there.

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis grong khyer ser skya'i gzhir byang chub sems dpa' sh'akya thub pa ni dka' ba lo drug spyad nas /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis grong khyer ser skya'i gzhir byang chub sems dpa' sh'akya thub pa ni dka' ba lo drug spyad nas /
translated: The gods of the Māra class said in the city of Kapilavastu, “The Bodhisattva Śākyamuni, after practicing austerities for six years,

original: rdo rje'i gdan las 'dzegs te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i gdan las 'dzegs te /
translated: has climbed up to the vajra seat

original: rtsva'i gding ba la grongs so //
analyzed: rtsva'i gding ba la grongs so //
translated: and has died on a mat of grass.”

original: zhes bsgrags pa gang yin pa des rgyal po zas gtsang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang blon po'i tshogs dang / grong khyer ser skya na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dang bcas pas thos nas sdug bsngal chen po dang / yid mi bde bas gdungs par gyur to //🔽sa 'tsho ma dang / ri dvags skyes dang grags 'dzin ma yang byang chub sems dpa'i yon @48a *//
analyzed: zhes bsgrags pa gang yin pa des rgyal po zas gtsang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang blon po'i tshogs dang / grong khyer ser skya na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dang bcas pas thos nas sdug bsngal chen po dang / yid mi bde bas gdungs par gyur to // sa 'tsho ma dang / ri dvags skyes dang grags 'dzin ma yang byang chub sems dpa'i yon @48a *//
translated: When this was announced, King Śuddhodana, together with the women, princes, and ministers, and the people of the city of Kapilavastu, heard it and were overcome with great suffering and mental anguish.

original: tan rjes su dran nas brgyal te sa la 'gyel nas chus gtor ba las slar dbugs byung ngo //
analyzed: tan rjes su dran nas brgyal te sa la 'gyel nas chus gtor ba las slar dbugs byung ngo //
translated: Yaśodharā, Nanda, and Gopā, remembering the Bodhisattva’s qualities, fainted and fell to the ground. They were revived by sprinkling them with water.

original: btsun mo'i spro bsring ba'i skye bo dag ni mig mchi mas gang la myur ba myur bar dbugs brdzangs shing /
analyzed: btsun mo'i spro bsring ba'i skye bo dag ni mig mchi mas gang la myur ba myur bar dbugs brdzangs shing /
translated: The people who were trying to comfort the queen had eyes full of tears and were sighing deeply.

original: dal bu dal bus smre sngags 'don cing 'dug go /
analyzed: dal bu dal bus smre sngags 'don cing 'dug go /
translated: They were speaking slowly and mournfully.

original: de dag sdug bsngal ba sangs rgyas la mngon par dad pa'i lha dga' ba skyes pa rnams kyis mthong nas /
analyzed: de dag sdug bsngal ba sangs rgyas la mngon par dad pa'i lha dga' ba skyes pa rnams kyis mthong nas /
translated: The gods, who were happy because of their faith in the Buddha, saw their suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sh'akya thub pa ma nongs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sh'akya thub pa ma nongs te /
translated: The Bodhisattva Shakyamuni is not dead.🔽He has attained unexcelled knowledge.”

original: 'di ltar des bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes so zhes smras pa gang yin pa rgyal po zas gtsang ma 'khor dang bcas pa dang / ser skya'i skye bo'i tshogs kyis thos nas mchog tu dga' ba skyes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes so zhes smras pa gang yin pa rgyal po zas gtsang ma 'khor dang bcas pa dang / ser skya'i skye bo'i tshogs kyis thos nas mchog tu dga' ba skyes so //
translated: When King Shuddhodana and his court and the people of Kapilavastu heard this, they were overjoyed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa na grags 'dzin ma la yang khye'u zhig btsas so //🔽bdud rtsi zas kyi yang khye'u zhig btsas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa na grags 'dzin ma la yang khye'u zhig btsas so // bdud rtsi zas kyi yang khye'u zhig btsas so //
translated: When the Lord attained unexcelled knowledge, Gopa gave birth to a son.🔽So did Yashodhara.

original: zla ba yang sgra gcan gyis zin to //
analyzed: zla ba yang sgra gcan gyis zin to //
translated: The moon was also released from Rahu’s grasp.

original: de nas rgyal po zas gtsang gis phun sum tshogs pa de mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po zas gtsang gis phun sum tshogs pa de mthong nas /
translated: When King Shuddhodana saw all this,

original: dga' ba dang mgu ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa rgya chen po dang yid bde ba skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mgu ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa rgya chen po dang yid bde ba skyes par gyur to //
translated: he was overjoyed, delighted, and full of happiness and joy.

original: des grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi rdo ba dang / gseg ma dang g-yo mo rnams bsal nas tsan dan gyi chus chag chag btab /
analyzed: des grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi rdo ba dang / gseg ma dang g-yo mo rnams bsal nas tsan dan gyi chus chag chag btab /
translated: He had the city of Kapilavastu swept clean of pebbles, gravel, and dust, and sprinkled with sandalwood water.

original: shin tu dri zhim po'i pog phor nye bar bshams /
analyzed: shin tu dri zhim po'i pog phor nye bar bshams /
translated: He had fragrant censers set out.

original: dar gyi chun 'phyang mang po dpyangs /
analyzed: dar gyi chun 'phyang mang po dpyangs /
translated: He had many silk tassels hung.

original: rgyal mtshan dang ba dan bsgrengs /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang ba dan bsgrengs /
translated: He had victory banners and flags raised.

original: me tog sna tshogs kyis dga' dga' ltar bkram nas grong khyer gyi sgo bzhi @48b dang; sum mdo rnams su yang sbyin gtong gi khang pa brtsigs so //
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs kyis dga' dga' ltar bkram nas grong khyer gyi sgo bzhi @48b dang; sum mdo rnams su yang sbyin gtong gi khang pa brtsigs so //
translated: He had the city gates and the crossroads strewn with various flowers, and he had houses for giving alms built at the four city gates and at the crossroads.

original: de nas grong khyer gyi shar sgor dge sbyong dang bram ze spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / ngan pa dang / mgon med pa dang / bkren pa dang / phongs pa dang / slong mo pa rnams la sbyin pa dag gtong ngo //
analyzed: de nas grong khyer gyi shar sgor dge sbyong dang bram ze spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / ngan pa dang / mgon med pa dang / bkren pa dang / phongs pa dang / slong mo pa rnams la sbyin pa dag gtong ngo //
translated: Then at the eastern city gate he gave gifts to ascetics, brahmins, naked ones, wandering mendicants, the poor, the helpless, the destitute, and beggars.

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / dbus kyi sum mdo rnams su yang sbyin pa dag gtong /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / dbus kyi sum mdo rnams su yang sbyin pa dag gtong /
translated: He gave gifts at the southern, western, and northern city gates and at the crossroads in the center of the city.

original: bsod nams dag byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams dag byed do //
translated: He made merit.

original: grags 'dzin ma'i bu ming 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma'i bu ming 'dogs par byed de /
translated: They gave a name to the son of Yaśodharā.

original: btsun mo'i 'khor gyi skye bos smras pa /
analyzed: btsun mo'i 'khor gyi skye bos smras pa /
translated: The people in the harem said,

original: 'di btsas pa na zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin pas /🔽de bas na khye'u yi ming sgra gcan zin zhes gdags so //
analyzed: 'di btsas pa na zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin pas / de bas na khye'u yi ming sgra gcan zin zhes gdags so //
translated: “When he was born, the moon was eclipsed by Rāhu.🔽Therefore, let us name the boy Rāhula.”

original: zhes btags so //
analyzed: zhes btags so //
translated: So they named him.

original: bdud rtsi zas kyi yang de bzhin du sbyin pa dag btang /
analyzed: bdud rtsi zas kyi yang de bzhin du sbyin pa dag btang /
translated: Pūrṇa also gave gifts,

original: bsod nams dag byas nas /
analyzed: bsod nams dag byas nas /
translated: made merit,

original: khye'u yi ming cir gdags shes bu'i ming 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: khye'u yi ming cir gdags shes bu'i ming 'dogs par byed do //
translated: and gave a name to his son.

original: nye du dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: nye du dag gis smras pa /
translated: His relatives said,

original: gang gi tshe 'di btsas pa na /🔽grong khyer thams cad dga' bar gyur pas de'i phyir khye'u yi ming kun dga' bor gdags so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di btsas pa na / grong khyer thams cad dga' bar gyur pas de'i phyir khye'u yi ming kun dga' bor gdags so //
translated: “When he was born,🔽all the city rejoiced. Therefore, let us name the boy Ānanda.”

original: zhes btags so //
analyzed: zhes btags so //
translated: So they named him.

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gis smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gis smras pa /
translated: King Śuddhodana said,

original: grags 'dzin ma'i bu gang yin pa 'di ni sh'akya thub pa'i bu ma yin no zhes smras pa /
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma'i bu gang yin pa 'di ni sh'akya thub pa'i bu ma yin no zhes smras pa /
translated: “The son of Yaśodharā is not the son of Śākyamuni.”

original: grags 'dzin mas thos nas yi chad par gyur to //
analyzed: grags 'dzin mas thos nas yi chad par gyur to //
translated: When Yaśodharā heard this, she became despondent.

original: de nas des byang chub sems dpa'i pang tshad kyi pha bong la zhon nas rol pa'i rdzing 'gram du 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas des byang chub sems dpa'i pang tshad kyi pha bong la zhon nas rol pa'i rdzing 'gram du 'dug ste /
translated: Then, riding on a boulder the size of a Bodhisattva’s lap, he sat down on the bank of the pleasure pond.

original: bden pa gsol pa btab pa /
analyzed: bden pa gsol pa btab pa /
translated: He prayed to the truth, saying,

original: gal te 'di byang chub sems dpa' las skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di byang chub sems dpa' las skyes pa yin na /
translated: “If this was born from the Bodhisattva,

original: de bzhin du rdzing 'dir pha bong dang lhan cig 'phyo bar gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzing 'dir pha bong dang lhan cig 'phyo bar gyur /
translated: then let it float on the pond together with the boulder.

original: ci ste ma yin @49a *//
analyzed: ci ste ma yin @49a *//
translated: If not,🔽then let it sink.”

original: na bying bar gyur cig ces smras nas chur bor ba dang / de shing bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin du pha bong dang lhan cig 'phyo bar brtsams so //
analyzed: na bying bar gyur cig ces smras nas chur bor ba dang / de shing bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin du pha bong dang lhan cig 'phyo bar brtsams so //
translated: He threw it into the water, and it began to float together with the boulder like a cotton ball.

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gis ya mtshan du gyur pa de thos nas /
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gis ya mtshan du gyur pa de thos nas /
translated: King Śuddhodana heard about this wonder,

original: skye bo'i tshogs chen pos yongs su bskor te /
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs chen pos yongs su bskor te /
translated: and surrounded by a great crowd of people,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rol pa'i rdzing 'gram du song nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rol pa'i rdzing 'gram du song nas /
translated: he went to the bank of the pleasure pond where the Bodhisattva was.

original: ji tsam na sgra gcan zin pa bzang po byang chub sems dpa'i pang tshad kyi pha bong la zhon nas shing bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin du chu na 'phyo ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: ji tsam na sgra gcan zin pa bzang po byang chub sems dpa'i pang tshad kyi pha bong la zhon nas shing bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin du chu na 'phyo ba mthong ngo //
translated: He saw Rāhulabhadra, the Bodhisattva, riding on a slab of rock the size of a bed, floating on the water like a cotton ball.

original: mthong nas kyang dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa rgya chen po dang; yid bde ba skyes te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / rangs pa rgya chen po dang; yid bde ba skyes te /
translated: Seeing this, he was filled with joy, delight, and happiness.

original: de ma thag tu rdzing der zhugs nas gzhon nu sgra gcan zin bzang po pang du blangs nas langs so //
analyzed: de ma thag tu rdzing der zhugs nas gzhon nu sgra gcan zin bzang po pang du blangs nas langs so //
translated: He immediately entered the pond, took up the young Rāhulabhadra in his arms, and rose up.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis bdud kyi 'khor 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug byams pa'i mtshon gyis mngon du btul nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis bdud kyi 'khor 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug byams pa'i mtshon gyis mngon du btul nas /
translated: When the Blessed One, with the weapon of love, subdued the thirty-six million māras and their retinues,

original: bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa de'i tshe sa chen po 'di shin tu g-yos par gyur to //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes brnyes pa de'i tshe sa chen po 'di shin tu g-yos par gyur to //
translated: and attained unsurpassed wisdom, the great earth shook.

original: 'jig rten 'di thams cad kyang snang ba rgya chen pos gsal bar gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di thams cad kyang snang ba rgya chen pos gsal bar gyur te /
translated: The entire world was illuminated with a great light.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten gyi bar gyi mun pa mun nag smag tu gyur ba nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing 'di ltar mthu che ba'i snang bas snang ba nyams su ma myong ba gang yin pa de dag kyang
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten gyi bar gyi mun pa mun nag smag tu gyur ba nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing 'di ltar mthu che ba'i snang bas snang ba nyams su ma myong ba gang yin pa de dag kyang
translated: In this way, the darkness between worlds, the pitch-black darkness where the sun and moon, with their great miracles and great powers, do not shine, will be illuminated.

original: de'i tshe snang brgya chen pos gsal bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe snang brgya chen pos gsal bar gyur nas /
translated: At that time, the great light will shine,

original: der sems can gang dag skyes pa de rnams kyis snang ba des sems can @49b gcig gis gcig mthong nas /
analyzed: der sems can gang dag skyes pa de rnams kyis snang ba des sems can @49b gcig gis gcig mthong nas /
translated: and the beings who are born there will see each other with that light.

original: shes ldan dag sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir skyes pa lta zhig /
analyzed: shes ldan dag sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir skyes pa lta zhig /
translated: They will say, ‘Sirs, other beings have been born here too!’

original: shes ldan dag sems can gzhan zhig kyang 'dir skyes pa lta ci zhig ces ngo shes par gyur to //
analyzed: shes ldan dag sems can gzhan zhig kyang 'dir skyes pa lta ci zhig ces ngo shes par gyur to //
translated: ‘Sirs, other beings have been born here too!’ and they will recognize each other.”🔽The summary:🔽The four assemblies, youth,🔽the father and son meeting,🔽the Śākya, the self-arisen,

original: sdom la / 'khor bzhi dang ni lang tsho dang // yab dang sras ni mjal ba dang // sh'akya de bzhin rang byung dang // dung skyong khyod la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: sdom la / 'khor bzhi dang ni lang tsho dang // yab dang sras ni mjal ba dang // sh'akya de bzhin rang byung dang // dung skyong khyod la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: and you, Dhṛtarāṣṭra, I pay homage.

original: de nas tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis shig tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na 'dug pa 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis shig tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na 'dug pa 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then two Brahmakāyika gods, who were in the Brahma world, thought this:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas na chu klung ne ranydza na'i 'gram byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs te mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring por ma lon par me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lteng rgyas na chu klung ne ranydza na'i 'gram byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs te mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring por ma lon par me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: “The Bhagavān Buddha, who has been dwelling at the foot of the Bodhi tree on the banks of the Nairañjanā River in Magadha, has not long been perfectly enlightened.

original: skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'das par mdzad nas /
analyzed: skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'das par mdzad nas /
translated: He has passed seven days in the fire element in one cross-legged sitting.

original: de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul gyi ma la bdag cag der song la tshigs su bcad pa re res mngon par bstod do snyam mo //
analyzed: de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul gyi ma la bdag cag der song la tshigs su bcad pa re res mngon par bstod do snyam mo //
translated: No one has offered him alms. Let us go there and praise him with a verse each.”

original: de nas tshangs ris kyi lha de gnyis kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas tshangs ris kyi lha de gnyis kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: Then those two Brahmakāyika gods thought this:

original: skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i dpung ba bskums te brkyang pa'am /
analyzed: skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa'i dpung ba bskums te brkyang pa'am /
translated: “Just as a strong man might bend or stretch his arm,

original: brkyangs ste bskum pa tsam gyis tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis tshangs ris kyi 'jig rten nas mi snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: brkyangs ste bskum pa tsam gyis tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis tshangs ris kyi 'jig rten nas mi snang bar gyur te /
translated: In the time it takes to stretch out and draw back one’s arm, they disappeared from the Brahma realm and arrived in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug ste tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis las gcig gis tshigs su bcad de gsol ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin nas phyogs gcig tu 'dug ste tshangs ris kyi lha gnyis las gcig gis tshigs su bcad de gsol ba /
translated: They sat to one side and one of the Brahmakāyika gods spoke a verse:

original: ded dpon g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba yi //
analyzed: ded dpon g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba yi //
translated: “O caravan leader, victorious in battle,

original: sdig pa mi mnga' bzhengs shig 'jig rten gzigs //
analyzed: sdig pa mi mnga' bzhengs shig 'jig rten gzigs //
translated: rise up, O sinless one, O seer of the world!

original: rin chen chos ni 'tshal bar 'gyur @50a *//
analyzed: rin chen chos ni 'tshal bar 'gyur @50a *//
translated: I seek the precious Dharma,

original: mchis kyis // bde gshegs chos kyi mchog ni bshad du gsol //
analyzed: mchis kyis // bde gshegs chos kyi mchog ni bshad du gsol //
translated: so, Sugata, please explain the supreme Dharma.”

original: cig shos kyis kyang tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis kyang tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
translated: The other also spoke a verse:

original: nga rgyal bcom zhing g-yul las rnam rgyal ba //
analyzed: nga rgyal bcom zhing g-yul las rnam rgyal ba //
translated: “Having conquered pride and been victorious in battle,

original: sdig pa mi mnga' bzhengs shig 'jig rten gzigs //🔽bcom lnga lon pa'i dgung zla nya ba ltar //
analyzed: sdig pa mi mnga' bzhengs shig 'jig rten gzigs // bcom lnga lon pa'i dgung zla nya ba ltar //
translated: rise up, O sinless one, O seer of the world!

original: khyod kyi thugs ni shin tu rnam dag lags //
analyzed: khyod kyi thugs ni shin tu rnam dag lags //
translated: Your mind is extremely pure,🔽like the full moon on the fifteenth day.”

original: zhes gsol nas de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: zhes gsol nas de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: Having said this, he disappeared on the spot.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One arose from his concentration and at that time spoke in verse:🔽Whatever worldly pleasures there are,

original: 'jig rten 'dod pa'i bde gang dang // lha yul byung bde gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dod pa'i bde gang dang // lha yul byung bde gang yin pa //
translated: And whatever pleasures arise in the heavens,

original: sred pa zad pa'i bde de la //
analyzed: sred pa zad pa'i bde de la //
translated: The bliss of the cessation of craving,

original: bcu drug char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: bcu drug char yang mi phod do //
translated: Does not approach even a sixteenth part of that.

original: khur khyer ba ni sdug bsngal te //
analyzed: khur khyer ba ni sdug bsngal te //
translated: Bearing a burden is suffering,🔽Abandoning the burden is bliss.

original: khur bor ba ni bde ba yin; ;khur ni lci ba rnams bor nas //
analyzed: khur bor ba ni bde ba yin; ;khur ni lci ba rnams bor nas //
translated: Having abandoned heavy burdens,

original: gzhan dag blang bar mi bya'o //🔽sred pa thams cad rnam spangs shing //
analyzed: gzhan dag blang bar mi bya'o // sred pa thams cad rnam spangs shing //
translated: One should not take up others.🔽Abandoning all craving,

original: 'du shes thams cad zad nas ni //
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad zad nas ni //
translated: And extinguishing all perceptions,

original: dngos po thams cad yongs shes na //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yongs shes na //
translated: Fully understanding all things,

original: slar yang sred par mi 'ong ngo //
analyzed: slar yang sred par mi 'ong ngo //
translated: One does not return to craving.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang / bde ba sku nyams su bstar bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang / bde ba sku nyams su bstar bas /
translated: The Blessed Buddha, having experienced the bliss and joy of liberation,

original: skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'das par mdzad pa na /
analyzed: skyil mo krung gcig gis zhag bdun 'das par mdzad pa na /
translated: Sat in one cross-legged posture for seven days.

original: de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul lo //
analyzed: de la sus kyang bsod snyoms ma phul lo //
translated: No one had offered alms to him.

original: de'i tshe tshong pa ga gon dang / bzang po gnyis shing rta lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig dong @50b pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshong pa ga gon dang / bzang po gnyis shing rta lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig dong @50b pa na /
translated: At that time, the merchants Trapusa and Bhallika were traveling with about five hundred carts.

original: lam de nyid du zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: lam de nyid du zhugs par gyur to //
translated: They entered the same road.

original: de nas tshong pa ga gon dang bzang po'i sngon gyi grogs po dang / blon po dang nye du dang mdza' bshes su gyur pa'i lha zhig yod pa 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshong pa ga gon dang bzang po'i sngon gyi grogs po dang / blon po dang nye du dang mdza' bshes su gyur pa'i lha zhig yod pa 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then a god who had been a friend, minister, relative, and ally of the merchants Trapusa and Bhallika thought this:

original: sdig can ji srid nga'i nyan thos mkhas pa gsal ba yid gzhungs pa /
analyzed: sdig can ji srid nga'i nyan thos mkhas pa gsal ba yid gzhungs pa /
translated: “Wicked one, as long as my śrāvakas are wise, clear, and intelligent,

original: pha rol gyi ni rtsod pa byung zhing byung ba rnams chos bzhin gyis tshar gcod nus pa rang gi smra ba gsal bar byed nus pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams byung bar ma gyur pa dang /🔽nga'i tshangs par spyod pa rgya chen po /
analyzed: pha rol gyi ni rtsod pa byung zhing byung ba rnams chos bzhin gyis tshar gcod nus pa rang gi smra ba gsal bar byed nus pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams byung bar ma gyur pa dang / nga'i tshangs par spyod pa rgya chen po /
translated: I will not pass into parinirvāṇa until I have monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who can refute any and all objections that may arise and who can clearly explain my teachings.🔽I will not pass into parinirvāṇa until I have taught my vast and holy conduct

original: skye bo mang po dang / lha dang mi'i bar la rgya cher yang dag par rdzogs par rab tu ma bstan gyi bar du nga yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' 'o //🔽de nas bdud sdig can 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: skye bo mang po dang / lha dang mi'i bar la rgya cher yang dag par rdzogs par rab tu ma bstan gyi bar du nga yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' 'o // de nas bdud sdig can 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: to many beings, to gods and humans alike.🔽”

original: kye ma'o dge sbyong go'u ta @53b ma ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' mi 'dod snyam du bsams /
analyzed: kye ma'o dge sbyong go'u ta @53b ma ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' mi 'dod snyam du bsams /
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, thought, “Alas, the ascetic Gautama does not wish to pass into parinirvāṇa.”

original: sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde la 'gyod pas de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde la 'gyod pas de nyid du mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: He was miserable, unhappy, and regretful. He disappeared right there.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das rlung nad kyi snyun gyis thebs par rig nas shing dzambu zhes bya bas dzambu gling du btags pa gang yin pa de dang ha cang yang mi ring ba zhig na /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das rlung nad kyi snyun gyis thebs par rig nas shing dzambu zhes bya bas dzambu gling du btags pa gang yin pa de dang ha cang yang mi ring ba zhig na /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, knowing that the Blessed One had fallen ill with a wind illness, went to a great myrobalan tree not far from the Jambu tree that gave the name to the Rose Apple Continent.

original: aa ru ra chen po'i tshal yod de /
analyzed: aa ru ra chen po'i tshal yod de /
translated: There was a grove of myrobalan trees.

original: de nas kha dog dang dri dang ro dang ldan pa'i aa ru ra blangs nas /
analyzed: de nas kha dog dang dri dang ro dang ldan pa'i aa ru ra blangs nas /
translated: He took a myrobalan fruit that was endowed with color, smell, and taste,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do; ;phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do; ;phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas /
translated: went to the Blessed One, and when he arrived, bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet, then sat to one side.

original: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he was seated to one side, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das bser ma'i snyun nad kyi snyun gyis thebs par bdag gis 'tshal nas /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das bser ma'i snyun nad kyi snyun gyis thebs par bdag gis 'tshal nas /
translated: “Lord, Blessed One, I know that you have fallen ill with a wind illness.

original: shing 'dzam bu zhes bgyi bas 'dzam bu'i gling du btags pa gang lags pa de dang ha cang yang mi ring ba na /
analyzed: shing 'dzam bu zhes bgyi bas 'dzam bu'i gling du btags pa gang lags pa de dang ha cang yang mi ring ba na /
translated: Not far from the place called Jambudvīpa, named after the rose-apple tree,

original: aa ru ra chen po'i tshal mchis te /
analyzed: aa ru ra chen po'i tshal mchis te /
translated: there is a forest of myrobalan trees.

original: de nas bdag gis kha dog dang dri dang ror ldan pa'i aa ru ra 'dir 'tshal te mchis kyis /
analyzed: de nas bdag gis kha dog dang dri dang ror ldan pa'i aa ru ra 'dir 'tshal te mchis kyis /
translated: I have gathered some myrobalan fruit, which is good in color, smell, and taste.

original: de bcom ldan 'das gsol cig /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsol pa dang / bser ma dang mthun par 'gyur zhing bser ma'i snyun nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das gsol cig / bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsol pa dang / bser ma dang mthun par 'gyur zhing bser ma'i snyun nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Please, Blessed One, eat it.🔽When the Blessed One has eaten it, it will be suitable for the wind, and the illness of wind will be cured.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsol pa dang / rlung dang mthun par gyur nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsol pa dang / rlung dang mthun par gyur nas /
translated: When the Blessed One has eaten it, it will be suitable for the wind,

original: rlung nad kyi snyun nye bar zhi bar gyur to //
analyzed: rlung nad kyi snyun nye bar zhi bar gyur to //
translated: and the illness of wind will be cured.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das shin tu bzod cing lhag par 'tsho @54a *//🔽par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das shin tu bzod cing lhag par 'tsho @54a *// par gyur to //
translated: Then the Blessed One became very tolerant and his health improved.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ji tsam dgyes kyi bar du byang chub kyi shing drung du bzhugs nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ji tsam dgyes kyi bar du byang chub kyi shing drung du bzhugs nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One stayed at the foot of the Bodhi tree for as long as he liked,

original: klu'i rgyal po btang bzung gi gnas gang na ba der gshegs te byon nas /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po btang bzung gi gnas gang na ba der gshegs te byon nas /
translated: He went to the abode of the nāga king Apalāla.

original: shing zhig gi drung du brten te /
analyzed: shing zhig gi drung du brten te /
translated: He sat down in front of a tree

original: skyil mo krung bcas nas sku drang por bsrang ste dran pa mngon du phyogs par bzhag nas bzhugs so //
analyzed: skyil mo krung bcas nas sku drang por bsrang ste dran pa mngon du phyogs par bzhag nas bzhugs so //
translated: and sat cross-legged with his body straight, and he sat there with mindfulness directed externally.

original: de'i tshe klu'i rgyal po btang bzung gi gnas su zhag bdun du dus ma yin pa'i sprin chags par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe klu'i rgyal po btang bzung gi gnas su zhag bdun du dus ma yin pa'i sprin chags par gyur to //
translated: At that time, for seven days, untimely clouds gathered in the abode of the nāga king Apalāla.

original: de nas klu'i rgyal po btang bzung gis zhag bdun du dus ma yin pa'i sprin chags par rig nas gnas nas mngon par 'phags te; bcom ldan 'das zhag bdun po 'di la bser bar 'gyur du 'ong /
analyzed: de nas klu'i rgyal po btang bzung gis zhag bdun du dus ma yin pa'i sprin chags par rig nas gnas nas mngon par 'phags te; bcom ldan 'das zhag bdun po 'di la bser bar 'gyur du 'ong /
translated: Then, the nāga king Apalāla, knowing that untimely clouds had gathered for seven days, rose up from his abode, thinking, “The Blessed One might be cold for these seven days.

original: tsha ba dang / sbrang ma dang sha sbrang dang / rlung dang nyi ma dang sdig sbrul gyi reg pas sku la gnod par 'gyur du 'ong zhes lus kyis bcom ldan 'das la lan bdun du dkris te /
analyzed: tsha ba dang / sbrang ma dang sha sbrang dang / rlung dang nyi ma dang sdig sbrul gyi reg pas sku la gnod par 'gyur du 'ong zhes lus kyis bcom ldan 'das la lan bdun du dkris te /
translated: He might be harmed by heat, flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and snakes.” He wrapped his body around the Blessed One seven times

original: steng du mgo'i gdengs ka chen po byas nas 'dug go /
analyzed: steng du mgo'i gdengs ka chen po byas nas 'dug go /
translated: He sat there with his hood spread out above him.

original: de nas klu'i rgyal po btang bzung gis zhag bdun gyi dus ma yin pa'i sprin chags pa med par rig nas /
analyzed: de nas klu'i rgyal po btang bzung gis zhag bdun gyi dus ma yin pa'i sprin chags pa med par rig nas /
translated: Then, the nāga king Takṣaka, knowing that for seven days there would be no untimely clouds,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku las lus phral te /🔽dpung rgyan dang / rna rgyan dang / phreng ba dang / rgyan sna tshogs dang / byug pas byugs nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku las lus phral te / dpung rgyan dang / rna rgyan dang / phreng ba dang / rgyan sna tshogs dang / byug pas byugs nas / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
translated: detached himself from the Blessed One’s body.🔽He offered the Blessed One a necklace, earrings, garlands, various ornaments, and ointments.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said to him:

original: bcom ldan 'das dgung bdun po 'di la bser bar ma gyur tam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dgung bdun po 'di la bser bar ma gyur tam /
translated: “Blessed One, have you not been cold during these seven days?

original: tsha ba dang sbrang ma dang sha sbrang dang / bser @54b ma dang / gdugs dang sdig sbrul gyi gnod pas sku la reg par ma gyur tam /
analyzed: tsha ba dang sbrang ma dang sha sbrang dang / bser @54b ma dang / gdugs dang sdig sbrul gyi gnod pas sku la reg par ma gyur tam /
translated: Have you not been afflicted by heat, flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, or snakes?”
